title: Sr. Manager, Tech Product Management - Marketing Analytics
role_description:
Large scale distributed systems; low latency environments; big data; machine learning. If these areas resonate with you then join us to work on extremely motivating challenges. In North America alone, we process 50B requests in under 30ms and evaluate our machine learned models to recommend the best response using our deep data. We leverage our petabytes-sized data clusters to derive industry leading analytics and provide unique insights for our customers. And, we do this across desktop mobile and video devices. We don’t use the latest technologies because it’s cool, we do so because there is no other way to work at this scale! Simply put, if you want to solve difficult problems with significant impact to the Amazon business, then this team is the right one for you

We specifically seek candidates who want to join the Ad Platform team focused on building large-scale systems that integrate big data across multiple sources to provide unique marketing analytics products. These products drive marketing investments into Amazon through proving the efficacy of Amazon advertising and retail promotion programs to brand advertisers.

You manage a team of technical product managers responsible for the full product life cycle, from product vision, strategic planning, prioritization, negotiations, financials and development to adoption and iteration with global advertisers, retail managers, ad sales managers and advertiser management teams.

You will be a self-starter with strong skills and experience in managing product teams in:
· product development to identify and execute on marketplace opportunities for unique marketing analytics;
· strategic business negotiations to procure new data sources;
· start-to-finish program organization to integrate and monitor new analytics into your overall product portfolio;
· using analytics products as sales tools to help advertising account executives drive revenue; and,
· at least one related technical discipline, whether software engineering for big data systems, complex system integration, or statistical analysis for big data science.
You will thrive on leading the go-to-market launch of innovative data analytics products while working across complex systems supporting petabyte scale advertising and eCommerce businesses (over 10B new events per day). You will want to dive deep and understand Amazon’s unique place in the advertising industry while challenging yourself and your colleagues to develop innovations that create more disruption.

The reward? You will build products that have never been built anywhere else (including Amazon) and grow into a unique business+tech leader on a team of brilliant engineers, scientists, and product managers who are making history!

title: Sr Product Manager, Advertising Measurement
role_description:
Amazon is one of the world’s most highly trafficked sites and delivering impactful advertising that helps customers find the right products and companies connect with their customers is one of our key business initiatives. The Advertising Measurement team is building a big data platform to provide machine learning based solutions to measure and optimize advertising.

You will play a leading role to define a product vision to build the appropriate data warehouse and leverage machine learning algorithms to deliver insights and optimize ROI for marketing dollars. You will have responsibility through the full product life cycle, from product vision, strategic planning, prioritization and development to adoption and iteration.

This is a high impact role on a talented and close knit team of economists, data scientists, program managers and software development engineers. Collaborating within and across teams, you will:
· Establish an industry-leading vision for marketing performance measurement and planning
· Build a big data platform and with analytics suite to measures the performance of advertising
· Imagine and deliver products to create value from the platform built
· Partner with engineering teams to leverage the unique Amazon eco-system to enable on-demand measurement and planning using state of the art data mining technologies.
· Engage with external customers and partners to identify key product issues and opportunities and build product roadmaps to drive value for our advertisers

You will thrive on implementing creative approaches and dealing with the intricate complexity of merging advertising data with our rich retail data, and diverse Amazon busiensses. You will challenge yourself and others to constantly come up with better solutions that disrupt the direction of the entire industry.

title: Knowlege Engineer
role_description:
Do you have fluent Japanese language skills? Do you have a strong academic background in a subject such as mathematics, philosophy, linguistics or library science? And are you keen to apply those skills at a technology company? This role is for you. As a knowledge engineer, you will work on:
• Representing real-world objects and concepts in ways that both computers and people can understand.
• Working to maintain the quality of the knowledge already in the system.
• Expanding the capabilities of the platform to infer new knowledge.
• Working with the teams of developers and machine learning scientists to enhance the existing technology and invent new techniques.
The system uses a lot of proprietary technology so you can expect full training and don't need any specific experience in the area. However it's a complex and demanding role, requiring a lot of raw talent and versatility to learn the full system and quickly become productive across all areas.

title: Knowlege Engineer
role_description:
Do you have fluent German language skills? Do you have a strong academic background in a subject such as mathematics, philosophy, linguistics or library science? And are you keen to apply those skills at a technology company? This role is for you. As a knowledge engineer, you will work on:
• Representing real-world objects and concepts in ways that both computers and people can understand.
• Working to maintain the quality of the knowledge already in the system.
• Expanding the capabilities of the platform to infer new knowledge.
• Working with the teams of developers and machine learning scientists to enhance the existing technology and invent new techniques.
The system uses a lot of proprietary technology so you can expect full training and don't need any specific experience in the area. However it's a complex and demanding role, requiring a lot of raw talent and versatility to learn the full system and quickly become productive across all areas.

title: Principal Product Manager - Technical, Integrated Ad Analytics
role_description:
Large scale distributed systems; low latency environments; big data; machine learning. If these areas resonate with you then join us to work on extremely motivating challenges. In North America alone, we process 50B requests in under 30ms and evaluate our machine learned models to recommend the best response using our deep data. We leverage our petabytes-sized data clusters to derive industry leading analytics and provide unique insights for our customers. And, we do this across desktop mobile and video devices. We don’t use the latest technologies because it’s cool, we do so because there is no other way to work at this scale! Simply put, if you want to solve difficult problems with significant impact to the Amazon business, then this team is the right one for you

We specifically seek candidates who want to join the Ad Platform team focused on building large-scale systems that integrate big data across multiple sources to provide unique advertising effectiveness products. These products drive ads sales through proving the efficacy of Amazon ad programs to brand advertisers.

You will have responsibility through the full product life cycle, from product vision, strategic planning, prioritization, negotiations, financials and development to adoption and iteration with global advertisers, sales and account management teams.

You will be a self-starter with strong skills and experience in:
· product development to identify and execute on marketplace opportunities for unique ad campaign analytics;
· strategic business negotiations to procure new analytics sources;
· start-to-finish program organization to integrate and monitor new analytics into your overall product portfolio;
· using analytics products as sales tools to help advertising account executives drive revenue; and,
· at least one related technical discipline, whether software engineering for big data system integration or statistical analysis for big data science.
You will thrive on leading the go-to-market launch of innovative data analytics products while working across complex systems supporting petabyte scale advertising and eCommerce businesses (over 10B new events per day). You will want to dive deep and understand Amazon’s unique place in the advertising industry while challenging yourself and your colleagues to develop innovations that create more disruption.

The reward? You will build products that have never been built anywhere else (including Amazon) and grow into a unique business+tech leader on a team of brilliant engineers, scientists, and product managers who are making history!

\u00b7 Bachelor\u2019s degree (technical major preferred)
\u00b7 Experience developing multi-year business strategies for technical products or services (data analytics preferred)

\u00b7 Proficient in SQL/Hive or scripting (VBA, Perl) or analytical language (R, Python, SAS)
\u00b7 Solid command of data integration software systems design & development and/or descriptive statistics

title: Sr. Business Analyst, Logistics
role_description:
Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrived you wondered how it got to you so fast? Have you wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon to deliver it to you? If so, the WW Amazon Logistics, Last Mile team is for you. We manage the delivery of tens of millions of products every week to Amazon’s customers, achieving on-time delivery in a cost-effective manner.

Amazon seeks a passionate, results-oriented, Senior Business Analyst to identify strategic initiatives that will form the next generation of Amazon Logistics. We strive to solve complex cost and cycle time optimization problems that no one has solved yet. Are you up for the challenge and ready to further develop your skills and long-term career? Look no further.

Successful candidates will have strong analytical skills and can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. He/she must have the experience and ability to create and present a roadmap that aligns with Amazon’s strategic objectives before a panel of senior executives. It’s crucial that this individual is able to influence and gain the buy-in of others on a large scale. This individual should be able to hit the ground running by analyzing root causes, determining and implementing long-term solutions, and supporting teams with advanced analytical, mathematical, and quantitative capabilities.

Responsibilities include:
· Identify the largest opportunities in the WW Amazon Logistics Last Mile space
· Conduct deep dive investigations into business problems and identify potential opportunities
· Identify and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
· Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers
· Analyze potential customer and financial impacts
· Work with in-house scientists, global supply chain, transportation and logistics teams, and software teams to identify new features and projects
· Identify ways to automate analysis through smarter software systems
· Prioritize projects based on their relevance
· Track realized savings and impacts, and communicate results with senior leaders
· This is an individual contributor role that will partner with internal stakeholders across multiple teams, gathering requirements and delivering complete solutions

\u00b7 Experience working with a wide range of predictive and decision models and data mining techniques, as well as tools for developing such models
\u00b7 Problem solving skills
\u00b7 Ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment; ability to re-prioritize on a regular basis in order to remain current with business needs
\u00b7 Self-motivated; ability to handle multiple responsibilities under limited supervision
\u00b7 Ability to present technical results appropriately given the audience

title: Content Editor, AmazonSmile
role_description:
Craft compelling, clear, creative and concise content.

We are seeking talented writers for AmazonSmile to help us engage with customers and charities. As a Content Editor, you’ll be working alongside marketing managers, product managers, designers and developers to create and publish customer- and charity-facing content across a variety of mediums, both in the US and internationally.

AmazonSmile is a simple way for customers to support their favorite charity every time they shop, at no cost to them. When customers “start with a smile” at smile.amazon.com, they find the exact same low prices, vast selection and convenient shopping experience as www.amazon.com, with the added bonus that Amazon will donate a percentage of the purchase price to their selected charity... and they can choose from nearly one million organizations to support.

You might be right for our team if:
· You have extensive copy-writing and social media experience.
· You are a tenacious self-starter, and a talented storyteller.
· You come armed with strong creative ideas and successful track record of creating innovative and engaging digital content.
· You are passionate about developing clear, concise and engaging marketing and informational copy
· You can create engaging social media content and strategies to drive engagement of charitable organizations and Amazon.com shoppers.
· You are able to optimize your content for maximum performance through frequent testing and data analysis.
· You are comfortable editing copy and business documents to assist non-editorial team members.
· You pride yourself on ensuring all copy reflects the Amazon brand and voice.


If that sounds like you, join us, and be part of an innovative program that impacts both the community and Amazon's core retail business.

We are a small team of engineers, scientists and business leaders, who work closely together in launching products which connect customers and charitable organizations through technology, at a scale only possible at Amazon. Come help us drive millions of dollars in donations to worthwhile charitable causes around the world. On the AmazonSmile team, you get to Work Hard, Have Fun, and Do Good!

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We strongly believe that the success of the AmazonSmile program is dependent on building a diverse team.

\u00b7 3+ years in a writing or editing role (not including internships); digital experience preferred
\u00b7 Professional portfolio of content
\u00b7 A flawless command of spelling, punctuation, and grammar
\u00b7 Social media copy-writing experience
\u00b7 Excellent communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills that enable you to earn trust at all levels
\u00b7 Self-starter with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment
\u00b7 Ability to conceptualize and execute projects, with strong bias for action and ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
\u00b7 Ability to work across teams and influence in areas without ownership"], "type": "Basic Qualifications"}, {"elements": ["These are not required, but any one of these will be strongly considered.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Amazon Search
role_description:
Senior Business Analyst: Amazon Search

Hundreds of millions of customers. Billions of queries per year. The scale and impact of Amazon Search is enormous, and we are looking for a Senior Business Analyst who will own uncovering deep insights into how our customers engage with Search, drive the metrics we need to gather for these insights, and make data-driven recommendations for the next generation of features our customers need to shop on Amazon.

The Search Customer Experience team is responsible for the customer-facing features, information, and look & feel of search results on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices globally. We are in the Search Organization where we partner with the teams that power search relevance, query understanding, browse, and product recommendations. We launch new products and innovation by partnering with Amazon’s category teams, from instant video, Kindle books, and Echo, to apparel, electronics, and groceries. We improve the customer experience by utilizing an immense amount of data from data mining, machine learning, usability studies, and customer feedback to build and test smarter search results.

In this role, your key responsibilities will be identifying the undreamt of connections among the volumes of data available in Search, creating actionable intelligence from these, and discussing these with various leaders in regular business reviews. You will define our analytical approach and metrics strategy, on how we track the performance of search over time and how these metrics vary by business segments (e.g. music videos vs clothing). These metrics would cover individual front-end search features, and also algorithms that power search behind the scenes. You will work with search product and development teams to build these metrics, and models to analyze their performance over time. You will be the company-wide search business intelligence expert, and will own driving discussion in regular reviews with Senior Leaders on unique customer problems this intelligence will identify, and influence the product roadmap that impacts millions of customers every day.

Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys working with big data, successfully translates often ambiguous business problems into actionable business insights, and above all else, is passionate about data and analytics. You Dive Deep into data to identify trends and patterns to yield actionable business insights. You can crisply communicate your analysis to senior management and business owners on an ongoing basis. You are a great collaborator who can work with internal and external teams to define and implement metrics that we need to measure our customers’ experience. You demonstrate a high sense of ownership, and are obsessed with customer satisfaction.

Specific responsibilities include:
- Gather the requirements for the search business intelligence needs for our team and our business partners. Work with engineers, and data scientists on the team to drive design and implementation of these metrics.
- Own the design, development, maintenance and delivery of BI reporting, analyses, dashboards. Drive a rhythm of reporting with senior leaders in our regular business reviews.
- Identify trends and connections with BI, drive decisions in our team and with our partners based on BI.
- Establish and continually enhance reporting and analysis processes.
- Model data from across various Amazon data-reporting tools to support ad-hoc analyses and metrics reporting.
- Perform deep dives to explain metrics or data anomalies, identify root cause for anomalies and provide corrective recommendations.
- Travel 10% of the time, mostly within the US
listings:
[{"elements": ["Basic Qualifications
- Bachelors in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Finance, or related field
- 6+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence/analyst role, including data warehousing and Business Intelligence tools, techniques and technology.
- 2+ years of experience interfacing at VP/Senior leader level to regularly communicate and drive discussion on BI.
- Excellent knowledge of SQL (Oracle, MySQL, or PostgreSQL)
- Experience with identifying the right BI reporting tools for the need.
- Previous experience in drawing insights from large volumes of data and clearly communicating them to the stakeholders and senior management."], "type": "Basic Qualifications"}, {"elements": ["Preferred Qualifications

title: Senior Supply Chain Strategist
role_description:
Are you a visionary looking for an opportunity to think big and challenge the status quo? Can you help Amazon develop a holistic long term supply chain strategy that will optimally flow billions of items from hundreds of thousands of suppliers to tens of millions of customers each year?

Amazon Fulfillment Services is seeking talent to join the Disruptive Network Design team. As a Senior Supply Chain Strategist you will be responsible for defining the vision of the future North American fulfillment network. You will use your analytical, technical, program management, and operations management skills to strategically plan the future of Amazon’s network of fulfillment centers across North America.

As a member of this team, you will be a thought leader in Amazon Supply Chain and will work cross functionally with engineers, research scientists, operations, software developers, program managers, and business leaders to design the Amazon fulfillment network of the future. You will help craft new fulfillment concepts to integrate into our network to improve the overall customer experience and reduce the total cost of fulfillment.

If you thrive in a constantly evolving business environment and are able to analyze large data sets to identify complex patterns and relationships resulting in operational solutions to real business problems. This role offers an opportunity to drive and influence business-critical decisions that will reduce overall fulfillment costs, while we continue to increase the speed at which we deliver our customers’ orders.

Responsibilities
· Perform complex data analysis to identify opportunities to reduce fulfillment costs, improve Customer Experience, and set priorities to improve them.
· Craft proposals for new concepts, improvement plans, 3+ year strategy, and overall business outlook.
· Provide strategic insights that challenge existing limitations and conventions to drive growth and performance.
· Partner with engineering and real estate teams to drive innovations in terms of future fulfillment center designs.
· Develop models that will support future business initiatives and improvements to the overall customer experience.
listings:
[{"elements": ["\u00b7 Bachelor\u2019s degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Finance or technical field from an accredited university or 2+ years Amazon experience

title: Senior Supply Chain Strategist
role_description:
Are you a visionary looking for an opportunity to think big and challenge the status quo? Can you help Amazon develop a holistic long term supply chain strategy that will optimally flow billions of items from hundreds of thousands of suppliers to tens of millions of customers each year?

Amazon Fulfillment Services is seeking talent to join the Disruptive Network Design team. As a Senior Supply Chain Strategist you will be responsible for defining the vision of the future North American fulfillment network. You will use your analytical, technical, program management, and operations management skills to strategically plan the future of Amazon’s network of fulfillment centers across North America.

As a member of this team, you will be a thought leader in Amazon Supply Chain and will work cross functionally with engineers, research scientists, operations, software developers, program managers, and business leaders to design the Amazon fulfillment network of the future. You will help craft new fulfillment concepts to integrate into our network to improve the overall customer experience and reduce the total cost of fulfillment.

If you thrive in a constantly evolving business environment and are able to analyze large data sets to identify complex patterns and relationships resulting in operational solutions to real business problems. This role offers an opportunity to drive and influence business-critical decisions that will reduce overall fulfillment costs, while we continue to increase the speed at which we deliver our customers’ orders.

Responsibilities
· Perform complex data analysis to identify opportunities to reduce fulfillment costs, improve Customer Experience, and set priorities to improve them.
· Craft proposals for new concepts, improvement plans, 3+ year strategy, and overall business outlook.
· Provide strategic insights that challenge existing limitations and conventions to drive growth and performance.
· Partner with engineering and real estate teams to drive innovations in terms of future fulfillment center designs.
· Develop models that will support future business initiatives and improvements to the overall customer experience.

title: Software Development Manager
role_description:
Interested in Machine Learning? Do you want to learn how Speech Recognition and Natural Language processing is powering Amazon Alexa and Echo? We’re building the Alexa Science Modeling Lifecycle Platform. We’re working hard, having fun, making history; come join us!

As a Manager of Software Development, you will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in design, development, test, and deployment of distributed systems and big data / data mining solutions. You will be working closely with Alexa scientists to accelerate the rate of innovation flow to deployments. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing distributed systems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment. You will be helping to hire and build your team and systems, and will own defining the road map for your group.
Key Responsibilities:
· Responsible for the over-all systems development life cycle
· Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments; Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team within an Agile/Scrum environment
· Management of departmental resources, staffing, mentoring, and enhancing and maintaining a best-of-class engineering organization

· Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to leadership and peers
If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, know how to deliver, are deeply technical, highly innovative and long for the opportunity to build pioneering solutions to challenging problems, we want to talk to you.

title: Principal Product Manager, Amazon Marketplace
role_description:
Want to directly make millions of dollars of impact to Amazon's bottom line and improve the experience for millions of customers? Amazon’s New Seller Experience team is responsible for making it easier for quality sellers to start selling on Amazon.com and grow their businesses. We’re looking for a Principal Product Manager who can define and lead our strategy to detect suspicious activity with new sellers and take actions to improve account security and prevent fraudulent transactions. Fraud prevention is a real money game where our software teams strive to outsmart and stay ahead of those who attempt to defraud Amazon and our customers.

As a Principal Product Manager, you will operate as the business owner for your products to engage customers, set strategy, define a product roadmap, work with research and engineering to deliver and then guide the execution to realize the business impact. The role is highly cross-functional and requires a candidate that enjoys navigating ambiguity. You will represent the New Seller Experience team worldwide where Amazon does business. You will be responsible for defining and driving the product roadmap from conception of ideas to the worldwide launch. You’ll work closely with a variety of stakeholders including business leaders, finance managers, research scientists, statisticians, business analysts, and software development and infrastructure teams. As our lead product strategist, you will define use cases, analyze the potential customer and financial implications, select the most promising ideas, prioritize them, and create a cohesive roadmap. You will also evangelize new features to our clients, working to accelerate their adoption, define key success metrics, measure impact, and track the business benefits.

Successful candidates will enjoy diving deep into data, have outstanding analytical skills, excellent communication strategies and be confident with executive level reviews. You will thrive in a highly collaborative, creative, analytical, and fast-paced environment and are comfortable interacting with highly technical development teams. You must have the experience and capability to prepare documentation for senior executives and align your roadmap with Amazon’s strategic objectives.

title: Economist - Customer Promise
role_description:
At Amazon, we are the most customer-centric company on earth. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join as an Economist for Customer Promise.

The Customer Promise team seeks to identify the optimal delivery option for whatever a customer wants. We believe that finding an optimal promise and living up to it consistently improves our customer experience because we increase customer's confidence and trust in Amazon as the one, best option to get what you want, when you want it.

As the Economist for Customer Promise you will be responsible for leading the research, econometric modeling, and analysis to determine the optimal customer promise. This entails developing analytic tools and economic models that take into account inventory, fulfillment center capabilities, carrier capabilities, customer preferences, and economic impacts to determine customer promise. The models you develop will drive changes in transportation and fulfillment networks to ensure we’re providing customers with the fastest delivery experience while optimizing costs.

You will work with a diverse scientific team including computer scientists and statisticians as well as other economists. You will build statistical models using world-class data systems to solve business problems in a fast paced environment.

title: Sr Technical Program Manager Homepage Personalization Team
role_description:
Do you want to help build a highly personalized homepage that greets each of our millions of customers worldwide every time they visit Amazon.com? Are you interested in managing projects involving large scale machine learning and personalization that will have enormous impact?

Amazon’s Homepage Personalization team develops and supports personalization and recommendations for Amazon customers across music, books, movies, fashion, and everything else that Amazon offers. We analyze petabytes of implicit and explicit feedback data on our hundreds of millions of customers and billions of products in order to guide the development of a meaningful and highly personalized homepage experience.

We are looking for an experienced and forward thinking senior technical program manager to manage our ambitious goals. This person will work closely with senior engineers, scientists, and Amazon leadership to help guide the direction of a deeply personalized homepage experience. In this role, you will be responsible for scoping, planning, and delivering on highly complex machine learning and personalization projects. Responsibilities include collection of business and systems requirements from internal and external customers, writing specifications, driving project roadmaps from design to release, and managing production launches and AB tests.
This is one of the foremost roles in technical program management with the opportunity to reach millions of customers on one of the highest traffic consumer websites in the world. If you are passionate about machine learning and personalization at scale then we encourage you to apply.

title: Software Development Manager, Automated Search Engine Optimization
role_description:
The Automated Advertising organization manages some of Amazon’s largest marketing channels worldwide. We bring prospective customers who are starting their shopping journey on search engines to Amazon. The Search Engine Optimization team is currently looking for a Software Development Manager to lead the development of our next-generation automated closed-loop optimization systems. Our vision is to maximize Amazon's rankings and visibility on search engines through the use of data mining, machine learning, natural language processing, and other advanced techniques.

As a Software Development Manager, you will be the single-threaded leader for the team and our program. You will oversee the design and development of systems and services that span the entire stack which will give you the opportunity to work with a wide range of technologies. You will guide a team of talented engineers to build large-scale, distributed systems and build solutions that will help customers to find what they're looking for in the most scalable ways. You will collaborate directly with business leaders and have direct influence over the technical and business direction of the team. Given the scale and the complexity of Amazon’s website platform and architecture, our problem space is truly unique and challenging. This position will give you the opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds in the field, learn about how Amazon optimizes its search rankings, collaborate with other development teams, work closely with machine learning scientists, drive innovations and make improvements that touch millions of customers.

Responsibilities:
· Responsible for the overall development lifecycle of our platforms and solutions
· Manage complex projects with significant business impact across the company
· Work with business teams to understand requirements and define product vision
· Work closely with senior and principal engineers to develop the best technical architectures and designs
· Instill best practices for software engineering and deliver quality solutions on aggressive schedules
· Maintain a high-level of operational excellence and balance between short-term and long-term objectives
· Hiring and career development of engineers

title: Software Development Manager, Last Mile Routing
role_description:
The Last Mile Route Planning team in Operations Technology is re-inventing the way we deliver packages to our customers, using new technologies and methods to solve complex operational challenges. To achieve that vision, we need a proven technical leader with an established background in building and driving roadmaps for software teams, developing customer-facing experiences, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment. This role will allow you to influence the future of Amazon's last mile transportation efforts, with the opportunity to make a difference on highly visible projects.

This role will allow you to work on complex challenges, using your quantitative abilities to identify opportunities, and play a key role in developing solutions. You will work at the intersection of operational processes and technology, and will need a strong understanding of both to be effective. You will be expected to dive deep into operational data, using quantitative methods and on-site observations to evaluate the current state of our operations, and your analysis will be critical in shaping our future technology and processes. You will work with research scientists and product managers to develop roadmaps and implement solutions, and will regularly interact with senior management to discuss your findings, proposals and progress. You will work in a fast paced and fast growing environment, where ideas are prototyped, tested, and implemented in short cycles, so you will see your inventions come to life.

If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, know how to deliver, are deeply technical, highly innovative and long for the opportunity to build pioneering solutions to challenging problems, we want to talk to you.

role_description:
Interested in Machine Learning (ML) and like to develop tools? Amazon Web Service's (AWS) Amazon AI is building services to enable AWS customers to leverage the cloud in developing, launching and operating machine learning solutions. You will own delivery of entire piece of the system and serve as technical lead on complex projects using best practice engineering standards, and mentor junior development engineers.

title: Senior Finance Manager, Supply Chain Optimization
role_description:
The Senior Manager of Finance, Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) will be responsible for providing financial support for sourcing projects that drive multi-billion dollar buying decisions. This role will work with retail leaders, research scientists, project managers, software developers, and regional Finance teams. The candidate will help prioritize execution of key technology programs which optimize free cash flow and drive inventory leverage. The successful candidate will design, develop, and maintain performance measurements on strategic projects to continuously improve the economics of the business.

The role is located in Amazon’s Headquarters in downtown Seattle and reports to the SCOT Senior Finance Manager.

Responsibilities will include:
· Directly support the Optimal Sourcing Systems (OSS) technology team, which includes multiple Directors and an organization of over 200 employees.
· Partner with Retail teams in vendor negotiations to drive hundreds of millions of incremental profitability through reduced freight costs and increased freight revenues.
· Help build a best in class imports program, which is growing exponentially and has high visibility from senior management.
· Partner with research scientists and economists to build inventory optimization models.
· Support vendor selection programs that influence nearly all buying decisions for the Retail business, resulting in millions of decisions every day and billions of dollars every month.
· Support new Technology programs which improve customer experience and financial performance through free cash flow and inventory management.
· Meet with Retail Finance and Category Leaders to drive project adoption and implementation across the business.
· Review and validate economic models and analytics ensuring initiatives are traceable to financial metrics and resource allocations are justified.
· Develop financial metrics based on statistical modeling and simulation techniques to audit initiatives.
· Coordinate and author narratives for MBRs, QBRs, Operating Plans, and project related deep dives.
· Build and maintain high level knowledge across all business areas by staying current on initiatives, challenges/opportunities across the business
· Prepare financial updates, including relevant analyses versus prior periods and providing forecasts/budgets, examining associated risk/opportunities with respect to Technology resources

\u00b7 Advanced knowledge of supply chain operations including inventory management, transportation and vendor management

title: Sr. Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) is looking for experienced software engineers who want to build Amazon’s next generation of inbound prediction systems. Our software is used by every country Amazon services, and is a critical link to ensuring the products our customers want are available when they need them.

As a Senior SDE in SCOT, you’ll work closely with some of the brightest software engineers, research scientists, and product managers to solve highly complex supply chain challenges. You will provide the technical vision for the team, create system architecture, building the software, and working with the team to deploy your solutions across the globe. SCOT is a unique opportunity to both create and see the direct impact of your work on billions of dollars’ worth of inventory in one of the world’s most advanced supply chains, and at massive scale.

You should be comfortable solving highly ambiguous business problems by creating innovate software solutions, diving deep into technical architectures and requirements, and driving the technical direction of the team. You should be able to provide design reviews for other engineers, including feedback on architecture and design issues, as well as integration, performance and scalability. You should be able to manage resources on multiple technical projects and ensure schedules, milestones, and priorities are compatible with technology and business goals. Successful candidates will thrive in fast-paced environments that leverage agile planning techniques, encourage and reward creative design, intelligent risk taking, and find innovative ways to leverage cutting edge technology.

title: I/O Psychology Intern
role_description:
Does the challenge of building innovative talent programs alongside smart, fun applied scientists sound like the perfect way to spend your summer? As Industrial Organizational Psychologists at Amazon, we are focused on attracting, developing, and retaining amazing employees who are strong owners, have the highest standards, and obsess over our customers.

We are hiring I/O Psychology Ph.D. interns for a variety of summer internship opportunities at our Seattle corporate headquarters. Paid internships are full time for three months with the potential for future full time employment. Opportunities are available in the following AREAS: Talent Assessment and Selection, Performance Management, HR Data Analytics, and Talent Program Design and Evaluation.
**PLEASE INDICATE YOUR AREA PREFERENCE(S) WHEN YOU SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION.

To qualify, an applicant must hold a Masters degree and be currently enrolled in an accredited PhD program in Industrial Organizational Psychology or related field. PhD candidates expected to be “All But Dissertation” (ABD) by summer 2017 are preferred.

You will:
· Be responsible for all aspects of one major project with mentorship from an Amazon I/O Psychologist; you will also contribute to additional projects and research
· Interact with senior level project sponsors and multiple business teams
· Conduct evaluation activities like surveys, focus groups, and interviews
· Conduct analyses like descriptive statistics, factor analysis, validation, adverse impact analysis, and regression.
· Analyze complex datasets and write reports of results; effectively communicate results to stakeholders
· Provide project management support including scheduling and conducting meetings, coordinating focus groups, and managing project timelines
· Maintain and update various databases

title: Sr. Product Manager
role_description:
Join the Amazon Online Display Advertising team (also known as Amazon Media Group) - and build the next generation of advertising products and platforms for advertisers and developers. Amazon is building and investing in technology to unleash superior ROI for advertisers and monetization for developers. We are doing this with innovative advertising experiences, advertisers capabilities and developer tools, all backed by Amazon’s scale and commitment to customer experience.

The Amazon Media Group is seeking a talented Sr. Product Manager – Display Ads Monetization to join the Yield team. In this role, you will own pricing and overall monetization of Amazon’s Owned and Operated (O&O) properties; and will be responsible for defining, implementing and monitoring revenue optimization strategies to maximize monetization across Amazon’s O&O properties. You will work closely with data scientists, sales, operations, and engineering teams in delivering and enhancing our portfolio of ad products.

You will be expected to make appropriate tradeoffs to optimize time-to-market, clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal cross-functional and remote project teams. Most importantly, you will be challenged to think big about new and unique ways regarding our monetization strategies.

The right candidate will possess a strong product and program management background, will have demonstrated experience leading medium to large products and projects, will have background in digital advertising, and ideally will have a well-rounded background in current web and mobile technologies. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in and get the job done.

As a Product Manager, you will be 100% customer focused, understanding their needs and requirements, plus anticipating future trends that will serve their needs. You will also be excellent at driving results, being able to coordinate large, multi-functional projects on-time, anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints.

Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence and leadership are essential to success in this role. You will be data-driven and analytical. You constantly strive to expand our understanding of the metrics that drive our business and growth aspirations. Lastly, your communication skills – both verbal and written – are excellent, and you will be able to clearly communicate at all levels in the organization, including senior management.

title: Director, Inbound Optimization
role_description:
Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrives you wonder how did the product reach from manufacturers to you and how is Amazon able to deliver such a large selection of products at low cost to your doorstep? Our systems use real time, large scale optimization techniques to automatically procure and source the product from suppliers and optimize the flow of goods across the supply chain to minimize the cost and lead time for customers. Our team is focused on saving hundreds of millions of dollars using cutting edge science, machine learning, and scalable distributed software on the Cloud that automates and optimizes supply chain under the uncertainty of demand, pricing and supply.

Our team is part of Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) group and we are looking for a passionate, results oriented, and customer obsessed technical leader to lead our efforts in building the next generation of software systems for Inbound Optimization. As part of SCOT, we design and build systems to optimize Amazon’s supplier network, and manage the flow of inbound products across our global fulfillment network. We do this for millions of SKUs, for hundreds of product lines worth billions of dollars of inventory procured world-wide. Our systems are built entirely in-house, and are on the cutting edge in automated large scale supply chain planning, optimization, and simulation. We are unique in that we’re simultaneously developing the science of supply chain planning and solving some of the toughest computational challenges at Amazon. Unlike many companies who buy existing off-the-shelf planning systems, we are responsible for studying, designing, and building systems to suit Amazon’s needs. Our team members have an opportunity to be on the forefront of supply chain thought leadership by working on some of the most difficult problems in the industry with some of the best product managers, research scientists/statisticians/economists and software engineers. Our software is used by every country Amazon services, and is a critical link to ensuring the products our customers want are available when they need them, and in helping us reduce costs for both Amazon and our vendor partners.

We are looking for leader of leaders who is passionate about building teams and cloud-scale systems from the ground up, and who want to help shape the roadmap for Amazon’s world-class supply chain management systems. As one of the senior leaders on our team, you’ll work closely with our engineering group, research scientists, and our executive team to design and execute your team’s product roadmap to support Amazon's rapidly expanding retail portfolio and merchant portfolio. You will lead efforts to improve your team’s performance and stability, drive recruiting and team building, developing and growing leaders, and help foster Amazon’s developer-oriented culture.
Successful candidates will have an established track record of building and managing large teams to deliver complex distributed software systems, keen technical aptitude, excellent project management skills, solid communication skills, and be driven to achieve results in a fast paced environment.

We have a team culture that encourages innovation and expect developers and management alike to take high degree of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture and project delivery. You will act as a leader who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. You are proactive in removing roadblocks, pave the way for innovation, and can handle multiple competing priorities. You are an experienced software development leader who understands and sets a high bar for all parts of the software development and deployment life cycle, including design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You work hand-in-hand with finance and business leaders. You will be responsible for implementing a product vision while satisfying scalability, reliability, performance, and budget goals. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical ideas in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including senior leadership.

title: Software Development Engineer – Advertiser Intelligence
role_description:
Amazon is investing heavily to build a global, best in class advertising business and our organization is responsible for defining and delivering a collection of self-service performance advertising products that drive product discovery and sales. We deliver billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and are breaking fresh ground to create world-class products.

Our Advertiser Intelligence team is looking for a Software Development Engineer to participate in the full development lifecycle of recommendation and forecasting systems that help advertisers and sellers easily create and manage even the largest campaigns optimized for various measures of effectiveness. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new product opportunities.

You will work closely with data scientists and other engineers to take machine learning models and other innovations from the lab to large scale production. You'll work on the data pipeline, machine learning models, API design and everything in between. As an engineer within Advertiser Intelligence, you’ll have a direct impact on your customers by putting our vast amount of data to work so we can help our customers optimize how to advertise their brands and products, increase sales and improve the Amazon shopper experience.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about quality, consistency, maintainability, performance, security and all the other things that make great software great. You will own the design and implementation of major deliverables end-to-end. This position requires collaboration with UX designers, product managers, technical program managers, and partner teams, necessitating a comfort-level with ambiguity and a desire to create, iterate and improve.

title: Sr Risk Analyst, Dangerous Goods
role_description:
Since 1995, Amazon has focused on being “the world’s most customer centric company.” Our customers are worldwide, and include not just consumers, but also our sellers. World-class retail brands and individual sellers increase their sales and reach new customers by leveraging the power of the Amazon e-commerce platform. To meet our vendor and sellers’ needs, our smart, diverse, customer-obsessed employees are constantly innovating and building on new ideas.

The Dangerous Goods team is looking for a passionate, results-oriented, Senior Business Analyst to dive deep into the business to identify strategic initiatives that will form the next generation of Amazon Dangerous Goods. We strive to solve complex problems to ensure the safety of our customers, employees, and supply chain partners.

Successful candidates will have strong analytical skills and can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. He/she must have the experience and ability to create and present a roadmap that aligns with Amazon’s strategic objectives before a panel of senior executives. It’s crucial that this individual is able to influence and gain the buy-in of others on a large scale. This individual should be able to hit the ground running by analyzing root causes, determining and implementing long-term solutions, and supporting teams with advanced analytical, mathematical, and quantitative capabilities.
The successful candidate will be comfortable with big data structures, intimately familiar with SQL, with strong analytical skills, curiosity, and a knack for solving problems and building business cases for program changes.

Primary Responsibilities
- Ownership of business intelligence and analytics functions helping drive the safe growth of our dangerous goods programs
- Use data to inform business, operations, and development teams on how to safely expand their business models to support the transportation of dangerous goods
- Work with in-house scientists, global supply chain, transportation and logistics teams, and software teams to identify, program opportunities, new features, and projects
- Prioritize projects based on their relevance and track realized savings and impacts, and communicate results with senior leaders
- Identify and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
- Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers
- This is a people manager role that will partner with internal stakeholders across multiple teams, gathering requirements and delivering complete solutions

title: Software Development Engineer
role_description:
We’re seeking a Data Scientist that wants to leverage both their analytical and software skills to research and innovate on Amazon.com performance. Our team owns making Amazon.com blazing fast, both for mobile applications and websites, and we need a great Data Scientist to help deliver this mission You will apply your skills to generate innovative ways of measuring and visualizing performance, as well as develop new models for prediction and classification across millions of unique visitors. We are a team of scientists, so in addition to mentoring and growth opportunities, you will also have a great collaborative environment to brainstorm new ideas and new approaches.

Your responsibilities will include:
· Interacting with decision makers from around the company to understand their needs and build solutions
· Understanding the causal sources that drive changes in performance
· Communicating analysis results, both verbally and in writing, to business leaders
· Validating and improving the performance data and analysis at Amazon
· Innovating new performance metrics and modeling reports for communication with business leaders

title: Economist
role_description:
Amazon.com strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. We hire the world's brightest minds, offering them a fast paced, technologically sophisticated and friendly work environment.

Economists at Amazon will be expected to work directly with the chief economist and senior management on key business problems faced in retail, international retail, cloud computing, third party merchants, search, Kindle, streaming video, and operations. Amazon economists will apply the frontier of economic thinking to market design, pricing, forecasting, program evaluation, online advertising and other areas. You will build econometric models, using our world class data systems, and apply economic theory to solve business problems in a fast moving environment.
The CIV and Buying Economics team is responsible for designing and implementing causal and prediction models for automated inventory management that understand both the short- and long-term economic implications of our decisions. As an economist on our team, you will be responsible for designing, validating, and assessing impact of your models and of our production system's decisions, as well as working with software developers and other scientists to incorporate your models into the production systems that plan inventory levels for the wide range of products Amazon carries across its various Retail businesses. You will focus on building models which identify causal effects amidst large, noisy, highly skewed datasets, with abundant exposure to confounding factors. You will advance our understanding of the variables and actions of importance to the causal effects we measure, and your results will drive important strategic decisions for our business.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Alexa is the groundbreaking cloud-based intelligent agent that powers Echo and other devices designed around your voice. Our mission is to push the envelope in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Understanding (NLU), Machine Learning (ML), Dialog Management, Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), and Audio Signal Processing, in order to provide the best-possible experience for our customers. We’re looking for a Senior Software Development Engineer to help build industry-leading conversational technologies and machine learning systems that customers love.


As a Senior Software Development Engineer for the Alexa team, you will be responsible for translating business and functional requirements into concrete deliverables with the design, development, testing, and deployment of highly scalable distributed services. You will also partner with scientists and other engineers to help invent, implement, and connect sophisticated algorithms to our cloud based engines. Prior domain knowledge including AI, ML, and NLU is a preferred, though not required. However, strong motivation to learn ML, AI and NLU is critical for successful candidates. Candidates should also be very agile in developing flexible software with respect to scientific, experimentation methods and usage patterns. Additional responsibilities include:
· Designing, developing and maintaining core system features, services and engines
· Helping define product features, drive the system architecture, and spearhead the best practices that enable a quality product
· Working with scientists and other engineers to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology, and evaluate technical feasibility
· Operating in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver high quality software against aggressive schedules

title: Senior Software Development Manager, Alexa
role_description:
Alexa is the groundbreaking cloud-based intelligent agent that powers Echo and other devices designed around your voice. Our mission is to push the envelope in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Understanding (NLU), Machine Learning (ML), Dialog Management, Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), and Audio Signal Processing, in order to provide the best-possible experience for our customers. We’re looking for a Senior Software Development Manager to help build industry-leading conversational and ML technologies that customers love. You will partner with world-class technical leaders, engineers, scientists and data analysts across the organization, who have expertise in a wide range of disciplines.

As a Senior Software Development Manager for the Alexa team, you will be responsible for leading multiple engineering teams and driving the design, development, testing, and deployment of distributed systems and big data solutions from AI, ML, NLU, and ASR research initiatives pushing the boundaries of machine intelligence. If you're as passionate as we are about making Alexa and Echo increasingly awesome for our customers all around the world, we'd love to chat with you! We're seeking highly talented, driven and motivated technical leaders with big ideas, who are also obsessed with finding new, intuitive, and engaging ways to interact with our customers.

A successful candidate will have an established background in building services, managing the development of existing code, scaling systems with large data sets, automation, developing customer-facing experiences, and delivering results in a fast-paced environment. Additional responsibilities include:
· Hiring, developing, and mentoring managers and engineers, and managing the day-to-day activities of the engineering team in an Agile/Scrum environment
· Working closely with engineers and scientists to architect and develop the best technical design and approach
· Owning the strategic planning and project management for long-term engineering projects, creating value for our customers
· Management of the over-all systems development life cycle
· Communicating effectively with senior management as well as with colleagues from research teams, software engineering teams, and other technical and business teams
· Regular reporting on the status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management

title: Sr. Economist
role_description:
How do you manage inventory when you don’t own it? How do you design and provide right incentives for millions of sellers that inbound and ship billions of customer orders? How do you optimize Amazon’s third-party supply chain using new ideas never implemented at this scale to benefit millions of customers worldwide? If these type of questions get your mind racing, we want to hear from you.

Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) optimizes Amazon’s global supply chain end to end and build systems to deliver billions of products to our customers’ doorsteps faster every year while saving hundreds of millions of dollars using science, machine learning, and scalable distributed software on the Cloud. FBA is an Amazon service for our marketplace third party sellers, where our sellers leverage our world-class facilities and provide customers Prime delivery promise on all their goods. SCOT has launched a new team called Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) Automation & Optimization to focus on optimizing our third-party supply chain and we are looking for an innovative, curious, and results-oriented Economist. Economist on our team will be responsible for designing and validating structural inventory management models that take into account seller, Amazon, and customer incentives to inform our global production system's decisions and setting seller policies and fees (marketplace/contract designs). You will then work with software developers and other scientists to implement these models to work in real time. If you are interested in solving highly ambiguous problems with large and immediate impact on one of Amazon’s fastest growing businesses, we would love to have you!

Key Responsibilities:
· Develop new econometric models using scalable techniques
· Extract data for analysis and model development from large, complex datasets
· Closely work with engineering teams to build scalable, efficient systems that implement prototypes in production
· Apply economic theory to solve business problems in a fast moving environment
· Distill problem definitions from informal business requirements and communicate technical solutions to senior business leaders
· Drive innovation and best practices in applied research across the Amazon research science community
listings:
[{"elements": ["\u00b7 PhD in Economics
\u00b7 Five or more years of experience in industry, consulting, government or academic research
\u00b7 Expertise in applied time series, reduced form causal inference or structural modeling
\u00b7 Fluency in at least one statistical software package such as R, Stata, Matlab, SAS"], "type": "Basic Qualifications"}, {"elements": ["\u00b7 Applicants with considerably more experience, including mid-career, are also strongly encouraged

\u00b7 Ability to work in a fast-paced business environment
\u00b7 Strong research track record
\u00b7 Effective verbal and written communications skills"], "type": "Preferred Qualifications"}]

title: Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technology team (SCOT) is looking for experienced software engineers and developers who want to build Amazon’s next generation of inventory planning systems. The SCOT group designs and builds systems that measure and manage Amazon’s supplier capabilities, identify and reacts to supply disruptions, and prioritizes inbound freight for our global network. Our software is used by every country Amazon services, and is a critical link to ensuring the products our customers want are available when they need them.
Imagine building systems to peer into the future and estimate the demand for tens of millions of products every week and predicting what we to have buy. Imagine engineering very large scale, intelligent software on the Cloud to buy these in the right quantities, at the right frequencies and at the right cost. Imagine developing algorithms to distribute these products to Amazon’s warehouses in the most cost-effective way, and when customers place orders, using real time, large scale optimization techniques to optimally choose where to ship from and how to consolidate multiple orders so that customers get their shipments on time or faster with the lowest possible transportation costs. Imagine saving hundreds of millions of dollars using cutting edge science, machine learning, and scalable distributed software on the Cloud that automates and optimizes inventory, supply chain and shipments to customers. Image knowing ahead of time where we need to build our next fulfillment center. This is what the systems we are building in the Supply Chain Optimization Tech team seeks to do.

As a Software Development Engineer in SCOT, you will work closely with some of the brightest software engineers, scientists, economists, and product managers, to solve highly complex supply chain challenges. You and your fellow engineers are responsible for designing the architecture, building the software, and working with the team to deploy your solutions across the globe. SCOT is a unique opportunity to both create and see the direct impact of your work on billions of dollars’ worth of inventory, in one of the world’s most advanced supply chains, and at massive scale.

You should be comfortable diving deep into technical architectures and requirements, be able to quickly identify solutions to challenges discovered during development, and ready to work with some of the latest cloud computing technology. Prior experience building stable, scalable, solutions is required. Prior experience with data mining, databases, or massively parallel systems is a plus. Successful candidates will thrive in fast-paced environments that leverage agile planning techniques, encourage and reward creative design, intelligent risk taking, and find innovative ways to leverage cutting edge technology.

title: Director of Customer Promise
role_description:
At Amazon, we strive to be the most customer-centric company on Earth. At the core of our global vision is the Promise team tasked with making industry-leading delivery promises and relentlessly executing to meet them. To achieve this, we begin with our customers and work backwards, leveraging data from millions of orders and billions of interactions to pioneer new scalable solutions to ensure we have the right products in the right place at the right time. We are seeking a Director of Product Management for Promise. The Promise team seeks to identify the optimal delivery option for whatever a customer wants. We believe finding an optimal delivery promise and living up to it consistently improves the customer experience because we increase confidence and trust in Amazon as the single, best option to get what you want when you want it.
As a Director, Product Management for Promise, you will identify opportunities to improve our customer experience and drive initiatives to design, develop, test and deploy Promise services that evaluate inventory, fulfillment capabilities, carrier capabilities and customer preferences to return an optimal delivery promise in milliseconds. To achieve this you will build a team of engineers, product managers, economists and research scientists and partner closely with Amazon operations teams.
This role is a highly visible and critical position within Amazon with significant customer impact. A successful candidate will have an established background in data science and product management with strong technical ability, project management skills, great communication skills and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment. In this role, you will:

· Establishing a vision & strategy for Amazon Delivery Promise
· Creating innovative solutions to drive customer value
· Working with Operations Leaders, Software Development
· Leaders and Finance partners to provide solutions
· Establishing and leading solutions across multiple teams
· Mining and analyzing data for metrics and decision support
· Driving results by exercising judgment using available information
· Monitor the impact of global supply chain and transportation performance on customer promises
· Develop and apply sophisticated quantitative analysis to produce actionable insights
· Evolve Amazon’s understanding of customer behavior by developing new metrics and around market demand as it relates to physical delivery
· Establish vision and manage feature backlogs for functional areas
· Exercise judgment in prioritizing between competing initiatives
· Provide clear direction and relevant communication to data science, engineering, and senior leader stakeholders regarding business performance and project status

title: Sr. Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Are you experienced in software development applying machine learning to big-data tasks? Are you excited by analyzing and modeling terabytes of text, images, and other types of data to solve real-world problems? We love data and we have lots of it. We’re looking for top scientists and engineers capable of using machine learning and other techniques to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.

The central machine learning organization at Amazon has multiple positions available for applied scientists and software development engineers in Seattle, Palo Alto, Berlin, and Bangalore for machine learning experts at all career stages, from graduating doctoral students to internationally renowned researchers and practitioners.

We solve many of Amazon's most difficult and important problems, and in partnership with teams across Amazon, we build new services that surprise and delight our customers. We have current and future projects in product understanding, streaming data analysis, natural language processing, deep learning, bandit algorithms, social networks, and more.


We are looking for passionate and talented Sr. Software Development Engineers who have experience building Machine Learning systems with big data. You will have an enormous opportunity to make a large impact on the design, architecture, and implementation of cutting edge products used every day, by people you know.

If interested, please apply directly online via this posting and our recruiting department will review your profile.

Responsibilities
· Build scalable, high-performance infrastructure for Machine Learning systems
· Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analysis and model development
· Research and use statistical techniques to create scalable solutions for business problems
· Work closely with scientists and engineering teams to create and deploy new features
· Work closely with stakeholders to optimize various business operations
· Establish architectural principles, select design patterns and mentor team members on their appropriate application

title: Business Intelligent Engineer - Selection Economic
role_description:
Amazon.com is seeking an outstanding Business Intelligent Engineer to join the Selection Economics Team.

Selection Economics team owns the selection plan and management for all of Amazon retail programs, include Prime Now, Bookstores, Amazon Fresh and others. We also own the systems to improve the profitability of our “unlimited” Amazon selections. We build the machine learning systems to calculate the completed assortment plan and maximize the customer experience by taking the amazon internal data and the competitors' data into the consideration.

You will have the opportunity to work in one of the world largest and most complex data warehouse environments using AWS technologies, you will help build data acquisition and processing pipeline that powers the selection models. You will work closely with our Research Scientist, Machine Learning Scientist, product managers and industry leading software development engineers to design and implement the innovation ideas. In addition, you will be responsible for developing customer facing metrics that will be used by internal retail, finance and operational users to understand the inside and accuracy selection data.

You will be responsible for designing and implementing an analytical environment, data platform, modeling metadata etc. to support the multiple systems in the team. You will also work with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing solutions to support analytical and reporting needs.

title: Software Development Engineer, AWS Machine Learning Platforms
role_description:
Interested in Machine Learning? Amazon Web Service's (AWS) Machine Learning (AML) team is Amazon's fully managed Machine Learning platform that makes it easy to build predictive models, manage them, and integrate them with custom applications for online predictions. We own and develop https://aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/. AML offers scalable regression and classification techniques on textual, categorical, and numerical data via easy-to-use APIs, an SDK, and AWS Console UI. It reduces the heavy-lifting normally associated with large-scale Machine Learning implementations, so that external developers and scientists can focus on the truly creative work of modeling and solving the business problem at hand.

In this role you will design, implement, test, document, and deliver large-scale, distributed software applications, tools, systems, and services using Object-Oriented programming, distributed programming, Java, SQL, and more in a Linux environment. Assist in gathering and analyzing business and functional requirements, and translate requirements into technical specifications for robust, scalable, supportable solutions that work well within the overall system architecture. You will serve as a key technical resource in the full development cycle, end-to-end, from conception to delivery and maintenance. You will produce comprehensive, usable software documentation; recommend changes in development, maintenance and system standards. You will own delivery of entire piece of the system and serve as technical lead on complex projects using best practice engineering standards, and mentor junior development engineers.
