title: Finance Manager
role_description:
Amazon is a fast paced, dynamic, technology company based in Seattle. The company ranked 18th on the Fortune 500 2016 list and continues to grow revenue at double digits, executing a simple strategy: “to be earth’s most customer centric company; to build a place where people can come to find and discover anything they might want to buy online.” Amazon has expanded that mission statement to disrupt and innovate multiple industries, including: live content streaming with Amazon Instant Video, tech products with the Kindle Fire and Fire TV and Echo, delivery speeds with two day/next day/same day/one hour shipping, cloud computing with AWS, and online payments with Amazon Payments Services.

The Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) Finance team is seeking a Finance Manager to support the Global Fulfillment Optimization (GFO) organization. GFO is a team of operations research scientists, machine learning specialists, software developers, and project managers who lead the industry in the development of innovative algorithms and optimization strategies to maximize long term profitability of Amazon’s Retail business. The team is responsible for driving cost effective fulfillment processes by optimizing network topology & node positioning, capacity planning, inventory positioning and order fulfillment. Amazon operates the most complex retail networks in the world, delivering billions of packages to hundreds of millions of homes and businesses annually.

The Finance Manager will serve as a key business partner providing financial perspective, guidance, and insight on the performance and optimization of a multi-billion dollar operations network. This position will involve interacting with a cross-functional team including software engineers, supply chain, and outbound transportation to build tools and simulations that explain, quantify, and increase efficiency across Amazon’s global network. The role will also work with other business unit stakeholders across Amazon to understand their respective costs across the network (i.e. how does the financial performance differ between business groups) and how to improve them. The role will be a key partner in defining and building the most cutting-edge technologies in operations, logistics, and fulfillment in an online retail setting.

Job responsibilities will include:
· Develop financial formulas for an analytic engine capable of dis-aggregating complex networks into a set of discreet inputs
· Build valuation models using simulation, A/B testing, regression models and other mathematical and statistical techniques to quantify financial outcomes
· Determine the optimal allocation of finite resources across competing priorities to maximize long-term profitability
· Define metrics and establish measurable goals to track inputs and outputs across business initiatives to measure and monitor success
· Deep dive and dissect algorithms to test hypotheses, understand and validate inputs, identify information bias, and uncover incorrect attribution to drive continued optimization of the global network
· Prepare financial updates, including variance explanations period-on-period, versus forecast, and versus entitlement

title: Software Development Manager
role_description:
Amazon’s Marketplace technology connects millions of businesses of all sizes to hundreds of millions of Customers within the Amazon.com marketplaces worldwide. The Seller recommendations platform provides the technology capabilities to generate targeted recommendations to the Sellers employing large data sets and realtime streams. The platform is responsible for making these recommendations available on multiple delivery channels. In addition, the platform has the foundational architecture to enable BIG Data processing at the Amazon scale.

As a Manager III for this platform, you will lead and grow a team of 8+ SDEs, Web Developers and Interns to build extremely large scale global systems. You will work with many clients to develop the best technical solutions to meet the needs for Seller recommendations and internal teams data processing.
Your responsibilities will include the following:
· Define a vision to extend the data processing platform beyond recommendations.
· Develop and own defining the path for employing more Machine Learning and AI to generate highly targeted recommendations.
· Work with data engineers and data scientists to grow the best in class data processing and analytics platform on the planet.
· Consistent focus on operational excellence of systems.
· Hire, coach and mentor SDEs.
· Develop long-term technical and business strategies.

A successful candidate will be technically deep with an established background in developing high volume and highly available services, great communication skills, ability to shape the structure and grow the skills of their team, and motivated to achieve results in a dynamic fast paced environment. We operate as a startup within Amazon, providing tremendous ownership over product and technology direction. This is your opportunity to make a direct impact on the satisfaction of our Sellers and the performance of their business on Amazon.com.

title: Software Development Engineer, Business Intelligence
role_description:
Do you have a passion for data quality? Are you interested in scalable solutions for Big Data analytics? The Browse team works within the Amazon Selection & Catalog Systems organization to present customer navigation options to millions of Amazon customers globally, including support of mobile, Kindle, and digital products. We are a fun, global, and collaborative group of data experts. Come help us develop and support analytics solutions aimed at presenting the best customer navigation experience in international ecommerce.

We are seeking an outstanding Senior Software Engineer to help build and support a cutting edge business intelligence platform and analytics program. Our primary users, an international team of taxonomists and developers, are responsible for customer-facing product navigation on global Amazon retail websites. The Browse Insights team influences day-to-day decision making for business priorities at Amazon and helps to proactively improve the customer experience through providing data targeted at product discoverability and shopping advancements.

Amazon has a culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, actionable, and scalable. As a Senior Software Development Engineer on the Browse Insights team, you will work with Research Scientists and Analysts to explore innovative data opportunities. You will build and design production systems providing metrics and tooling integration, to address some of the unique challenges related to online product discovery. You will lead the design and implementation of significant technical projects and work with product/ program managers, internal customers, and other Engineering teams to influence the technical strategy of the organization.

title: Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Amazon.com's Display Advertising team builds and manages systems with extreme high performance and availability. We serve and respond to hundreds of billions of requests annually, and have ambitions to grow that number several orders of magnitude, while maintaining response latencies in the milliseconds and meeting strict SLA requirements. We delight in data, and are constantly trying to enrich our models and make more informed decisions using every bit and byte we have. Our current systems serve our current needs, but we are growing a new business within Amazon.com, and are looking for the sort of hands on leaders and developers who can design and build the systems that will take us into the future.

About you:
You're looking for a career where you'll be able to build, to deliver, and to impress. You look at problems holistically, and thrive on the intricate complexity of designing feedback loops and ecosystems. You want to work on projects where you are implementing solutions to real problems that require creative solutions and deep understanding of the problem space. You challenge yourself and others to constantly come up with better solutions. This highly visible role requires frequent communication with senior leadership in order to help shape and deliver on the product roadmap, and requires you to nimbly switch between strategic and tactical initiatives to achieve technical, business, and customer experience goals. You'll be given an opportunity to own and drive initiatives through the entire software stack -- from customer facing features, to algorithmic innovation, all the way down to the datasets that the back-end services consume.

About us together:
We're going to change the way that the advertising world measures, plans, and buys. Along the way, we're going to face seemingly impossible problems. We're going to argue about how to solve them, and we'll work together to find a solution that is superior to each of the proposals we came in with. We'll make tough decisions, but we'll all understand why. We'll be the dream team.

The ideal developer for this space will be highly quantitative, have great judgment and passion for building a great customer experience, be inventive, and have a strong track record of delivery. You also have a pragmatic approach and iterative approach to building software: you have an ability to simplify and get things done with a demonstrated track record of building and delivering software and working effectively with external and internal teams.

Some problem spaces we'll be working on:

AD PLATFORM - accessing this data and making decisions across large numbers of potential responses in a matter of milliseconds is a tough problem, and requires complex high scale engineering both online and offline. You may specialize in one area or another, but will need to consider the problem holistically. Today, we are a global operation with infrastructure in North America, Europe and Asia and we are looking to enter India and Brazil. Our platform is hosted in AWS and we serve ads for Mobile (mobile web, Amazon mobile APPs and 3rd Party Mobile Apps) and Desktop Web (both on Amazon owned and operated properties as well as third party sites via Ad Exchanges and Direct relationships). we are looking to continue to rearchitect the platform this year to better enable us to handle the demands of scaling the business enabling both enterprise managed- and self-service growth in addition to small business self-service growth.

OPTIMIZATION - we have a wealth of data already about the customers we interact with; what they've been shopping for, what they've recently purchased, etc. Couple that with an almost overwhelming amount of real-time data and the need to build the best models to predict which signals are likely to have an impact and which aren't. We're building platforms to automate the generation, validation, and publishing of models that incorporate all available data to predict performance against our customers' goals. You’ll need to be both an engineer and scientist – you’ll build the platforms to test and measure your hypotheses, iterate on your designs, and find innovative signals and solutions that fundamentally shift the effectiveness of our systems.

EXPERIMENTATION - advertisers spend a lot of money to develop their ads, and we want to ensure that those ads will drive the best performance possible. To do so, we need to develop the data, analysis and technical frameworks to enable incredibly precise, highly impactful decisions that directly impact the ad performance. Furthermore, the experimentation framework needs to provide the ability for our internal partners to configure and execute experiments on our algorithms and infrastructure with sufficiently low friction to encourage further experimentation.

Questions?:
You may already know if you're a fit, but perhaps you're worried about technology and experience requirements? Don't be - we're looking for smart, proven, engineers; if you're the right candidate, we're flexible.

[{"elements": ["\u00b7 Bachelor\u2019s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related technical discipline.
\u00b7 6+ years of software development experience.
\u00b7 Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as C, C++, C#, Java
\u00b7 Object Oriented Design and familiarity with application and database programming under UNIX/Linux.
\u00b7 A strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional, projects
\u00b7 Deep hands-on technical expertise, excellent verbal and written communication skills
\u00b7 Experience with Agile (SCRUM, RUP, XP), OO modeling, web services, UNIX, middleware, database and data mining systems
\u00b7 Experience mentoring and training the engineering community on complex technical issues
\u00b7 Sharp analytical abilities and proven design skills"], "type": "Basic Qualifications"}, {"elements": ["\u00b7 Masters degree in computer science, Math or Physics or related field

\u00b7 Experience with building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.
\u00b7 Solid experience with Javascript, HTML, CSS, and web standards.
\u00b7 Solid experience working with SQL databases.
\u00b7 A high degree of pragmatism in building the simplest thing that does the job; we want to use technology to solve real-world problems expediently, not indulge in over-designed, unnecessarily intricate software architecture.

About you:
You're looking for a career where you'll be able to build, to deliver, and to impress. You look at problems holistically, and thrive on the intricate complexity of designing feedback loops and ecosystems. You want to work on projects where you are implementing solutions to real problems that require creative solutions and deep understanding of the problem space. You challenge yourself and others to constantly come up with better solutions. This highly visible role requires frequent communication with senior leadership in order to help shape and deliver on the product roadmap, and requires you to nimbly switch between strategic and tactical initiatives to achieve technical, business, and customer experience goals. You'll be given an opportunity to own and drive initiatives through the entire software stack -- from customer facing features, to algorithmic innovation, all the way down to the datasets that the back-end services consume.

About us together:
We're going to change the way that the advertising world measures, plans, and buys. Along the way, we're going to face seemingly impossible problems. We're going to argue about how to solve them, and we'll work together to find a solution that is superior to each of the proposals we came in with. We'll make tough decisions, but we'll all understand why. We'll be the dream team.

The ideal developer for this space will be highly quantitative, have great judgment and passion for building a great customer experience, be inventive, and have a strong track record of delivery. You also have a pragmatic approach and iterative approach to building software: you have an ability to simplify and get things done with a demonstrated track record of building and delivering software and working effectively with external and internal teams.

Some problem spaces we'll be working on:

AD PLATFORM - accessing this data and making decisions across large numbers of potential responses in a matter of milliseconds is a tough problem, and requires complex high scale engineering both online and offline. You may specialize in one area or another, but will need to consider the problem holistically. Today, we are a global operation with infrastructure in North America, Europe and Asia and we are looking to enter India and Brazil. Our platform is hosted in AWS and we serve ads for Mobile (mobile web, Amazon mobile APPs and 3rd Party Mobile Apps) and Desktop Web (both on Amazon owned and operated properties as well as third party sites via Ad Exchanges and Direct relationships). we are looking to continue to rearchitect the platform this year to better enable us to handle the demands of scaling the business enabling both enterprise managed- and self-service growth in addition to small business self-service growth.

OPTIMIZATION - we have a wealth of data already about the customers we interact with; what they've been shopping for, what they've recently purchased, etc. Couple that with an almost overwhelming amount of real-time data and the need to build the best models to predict which signals are likely to have an impact and which aren't. We're building platforms to automate the generation, validation, and publishing of models that incorporate all available data to predict performance against our customers' goals. You’ll need to be both an engineer and scientist – you’ll build the platforms to test and measure your hypotheses, iterate on your designs, and find innovative signals and solutions that fundamentally shift the effectiveness of our systems.

EXPERIMENTATION - advertisers spend a lot of money to develop their ads, and we want to ensure that those ads will drive the best performance possible. To do so, we need to develop the data, analysis and technical frameworks to enable incredibly precise, highly impactful decisions that directly impact the ad performance. Furthermore, the experimentation framework needs to provide the ability for our internal partners to configure and execute experiments on our algorithms and infrastructure with sufficiently low friction to encourage further experimentation.

Questions?:
You may already know if you're a fit, but perhaps you're worried about technology and experience requirements? Don't be - we're looking for smart, proven, engineers; if you're the right candidate, we're flexible.

title: Principal Product Manager, Amazon Payment Experience
role_description:
Amazon’s Payment Acceptance and Experience organization is seeking a true product leader, who is passionate about building consumer products that deliver value to our customers. In this role, you will be defining Amazon-wide consumer payment experiences in partnership with UX Designers, Data Scientists and Software Engineers. Payments is a deep and complex area at Amazon that will require you to dive deep on how worldwide customers prefer to pay for goods and services and translating those requirements to our CX and Platform teams to develop systems that scale to billions of customers.

You will be responsible for designing, managing and optimizing the foundation which enables every customer to purchase on Amazon. Specifically your product enables internal businesses to leverage the power of Amazon's payments platform and deliver the best paying experience to Amazon’s customers around the globe. You will own productizing and evolving existing services to allow Amazon to enable new paying experiences and payment methods at low cost, low time to market and increased agility. Additionally, you will own developing new solutions to enable paying experiences for new businesses and channels across web, mobile, and new commerce channels.

title: Software Dev. Manager
role_description:
Amazon strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. We hire the world's brightest minds, offering them a fast paced, technologically sophisticated and friendly work environment.
The Economics team at Amazon works with senior management on key business problems faced in retail, international retail, cloud computing, third party merchants, search, Kindle and operations. Amazon economists apply the frontier of economic thinking to market design, pricing, forecasting, online advertising and other areas.

title: Senior Product Manager, Geocoding - Amazon Maps
role_description:
At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer-centric company on earth. One customer experience that we’re constantly looking to take to a new level is how we fulfil and deliver their orders. Our goal is to exceed the expectations of all our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small are delivered where and when they need them, as quickly, accurately, and cost effectively as possible.

To meet this goal, The Operations Technology team is re-inventing the way we deliver packages to our customers, using new technologies and methods to solve complex operational challenges. To achieve that vision, we are looking for a Product Manager with industry experience and a passion for invention. This role will allow you to influence the future of Amazon fulfillment, with the opportunity to make a difference on a highly visible projects.

In your role you will drive the vision and strategy, work with stakeholders, interpreting business requirements and developing solutions to the rich and complex problem of geocoding across the globe. You will work with industry experts, research scientists, and teams of engineers to gather data and implement best in class solutions. You will also interact with senior management to present your ideas. You will work in a fast paced environment, where ideas are prototyped, tested, and implemented in short cycles, so you will see your inventions come to life.

title: Sr. Economist, EC2 Spot - AWS
role_description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in hundreds of countries around the world.

The EC2 Spot team is seeking an Economist who wants to revolutionize the way people consume resources on the world’s largest dynamically priced market for compute capacity.

If highly parallel systems, distributed functionality and dynamic pricing problems make you want to take control, we have the right challenge for you. You should have a good understanding of data consistency and transactions between distributed services.

As an Economist in AWS, you’ll specifically be expected to:
· Establish best practices for developing and implementing predictive analytics evaluation models
· Adapt existing and invent new techniques with our machine learning experts in the pricing, revenue & capacity management domains
· Implement techniques in a highly available distributed web service
· Work closely with service engineers, product managers, other applied scientists, and customers
· File for patents, publish research work, and give internal and external presentations about a wide range of technical problems in your area of expertise

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) is looking for experienced software engineers who want to build Amazon’s next generation of buying systems. Our software is used by every country Amazon services, and is a critical link to ensuring the products our customers want are available when they need them.

As an SDE in SCOT, you’ll work closely with some of the brightest software engineers, research scientists, and product managers to solve highly complex supply chain challenges. You and your fellow engineers are responsible for designing the architecture, building the software, and working with the team to deploy your solutions across the globe. SCOT is a unique opportunity to both create and see the direct impact of your work on billions of dollars’ worth of inventory in one of the world’s most advanced supply chains, and at massive scale.

You should be comfortable diving deep into technical architectures and requirements, be able to quickly identify solutions to challenges discovered during development, and ready to work with some of the latest cloud computing technology. Prior experience building stable, scalable, solutions is required. Prior experience with data mining, databases, or massively parallel systems is a plus. Successful candidates will thrive in fast-paced environments that leverage agile planning techniques, encourage and reward creative design, intelligent risk taking, and find innovative ways to leverage cutting edge technology.

title: Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Come help us build a world class systems to support a range of computer vision applications running in Amazon Fulfillment Centers. In addition to handling tens of thousands of devices deployed worldwide, the Amazon Item Intelligence team is applying computer vision and image processing to solve real-world business problems. Our team’s charter is to work with our product fulfillment teams to invent process improvement technology and deploy solutions into the world’s largest retail fulfillment environment. Our team collaborates with a wide variety of customers across Amazon worldwide, to conceive, develop, prototype and deploy a wide range of platform applications.

You have solid engineering skills and are willing to dive in and build scalable systems. In addition, you will collaborate with research scientists to develop and deploy computer-vision-powered process improvement to Amazon facilities worldwide. We need you to contribute to the creation of production quality software to handle device provisioning, deployments, data storage and movement.
You will visit Amazon fulfillment centers to observe processes and brainstorm application ideas to improve them. You will build prototypes and production quality code. You are a person with a commitment to team work, who enjoys working on complex software systems, is customer centric, and thrives on the challenge of building systems that can be operated at world-wide scale.

title: Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Do you have passion for Robotics, IoT and automation? Interested in the fields of Computer Vision and Machine Learning? Whether or not you have prior experience in those areas, we have an opportunity for you to apply your software development skills to make the future happen faster.

Amazon Fulfillment Technologies powers the physical engine at the heart of Amazon: we build and operate the software, hardware, and processes that run Amazon’s global network of fulfillment centers. Our systems move many millions of units of inventory each day, are used by tens of thousands of people, and ensure that customers get what they want when we promised we would get it to them.

Our environment is global and complex with a variety of systems, including industrial machines and robotics. We are constantly innovating in the ways we are automating and accelerating the delivery of products and packages which includes building custom hardware and applying machine learning, computer vision, and real-time data processing using distributed systems.

As a Software Development Engineer in our team you will work closely with Applied Research Scientists and Principal/Senior Engineers to build resilient and highly scalable systems that will power state of the art automation systems for our fulfillment centers.

title: Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) is looking for software engineers who want to build Amazon’s next generation of inbound prediction systems and procurement systems. Our software is used by every country Amazon services, and is a critical link to ensuring the products our customers want are available when they need them.

As an SDE in SCOT, you’ll work closely with some of the brightest software engineers, research scientists, and product managers to solve highly complex supply chain challenges. You and your fellow engineers are responsible for designing the architecture, building the software, and working with the team to deploy your solutions across the globe. SCOT is a unique opportunity to both create and see the direct impact of your work on billions of dollars’ worth of inventory in one of the world’s most advanced supply chains, and at massive scale.

You should be comfortable diving deep into technical architectures and requirements, be able to quickly identify solutions to challenges discovered during development, and ready to work with some of the latest cloud computing technology. Prior experience building stable, scalable, solutions is required. Prior experience with data mining, databases, or massively parallel systems is a plus. Successful candidates will thrive in fast-paced environments that leverage agile planning techniques, encourage and reward creative design, intelligent risk taking, and find innovative ways to leverage cutting edge technology.

title: Software Development Manager (SDM), Personalization
role_description:
Consider the following problem: every day, millions of customers with unique interests and needs come to Amazon looking for products and information from a catalog of millions of items. What do we show each customer to help them make timely and meaningful shopping decisions and discover more parts of Amazon's vast catalog?

In Personalization, we answer this question using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and A/B testing, running experiments on some of Amazon’s most prominent and valuable pages. We are a full stack team working on a diverse set of products, ranging from one of the largest-scale machine learning systems in the company, to real-time, low-latency recommendation and ranking systems, building algorithms for understanding customer behavior and generating recommendations content, to building customer-facing UIs. As a member of the team, you will work in a collaborative environment with a team of rock star product managers, software development managers, engineers, ML scientists, and designers. You will have a unique opportunity to drive direct, measurable impact to millions of customers, powering features on the website that generate billions of dollars of revenue every year.

About our team:
We are a specialized team within Personalization investing in personalizing the Amazon customer experience for key strategic regional and expedited delivery programs including Amazon Fresh, PrimeNow, Prime SameDay delivery, and other yet-to-be-disclosed programs and features. Our team has the autonomy to decide where we can have the most impact and get down to experimenting. We love metrics, a fast pace, and new ideas. We analyze data to uncover potential opportunities, generate hypotheses, and test them. We are a SWAT team that swoops in and gets things done to improve the customer experience and increase engagement. We refuse to accept constraints, internal or external, and we have a strong bias for action. We imagine, build prototypes, validate ideas, and launch follow-up experiments that iterate on successful ones. Our features providing meaningful content to drive customer satisfaction and earn their loyalty.

About the role:
As an Amazon Software Development Manager, you will be responsible for the design, development, testing, and operations of features and systems owned by your team. You will be working on go-to-market and early-stage expansion initiatives to custom-fit recommendation features, data sets, and algorithms to these programs, and to develop and test new ideas. You will manage a team of outstanding full-stack developers, focusing heavily on career development and improving development processes, while remove bottlenecks and friction to deliver world class improvements in customer experience. This role requires working closely with product management to define strategy and requirements, and leading development teams from design through delivery and subsequent operation. This position will also require regular communication with senior management on status, risks, and strategy. Your friends and family will know what you do, because you can take out your phone and show them.

About you:
You are a former engineer who can see the bigger picture. While your career is full of individual wins as an engineer, it is now more fulfilling when your team is able to build, deliver, and impress. You enjoy leading and mentoring software engineers. You want to work on projects that require innovative and creative thinking and deep technical problem solving. You challenge yourself and others to constantly come up with better solutions. You're a thought leader, have a high bar for coding excellence, a passion for design and architecture, and are a clear communicator. You thrive in and enjoy maintaining a diverse and fun work environment that encourages customer obsession, bias for action, and work/life balance. You love attracting and growing high caliber-talent, and have a track record to prove it. You aren’t phased by ambiguity, and are always open to identifying alternative paths. You have an established track record of launching customer-facing experiences, deep technical ability, and excellent project management and communication skills.

title: Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer
role_description:
Amazon is growing rapidly and because we are driven by faster delivery to customers, a more efficient supply chain network, and lower cost of operations, our main focus is in the development of analytical strategic models and automation tools fed by our massive amounts of available data. You will be responsible for building these models/tools that improve the economics of Amazon’s worldwide fulfillment networks in North America, European, and Japan, China, and India as Amazon increases the speed and decreases the cost to deliver products to customers.

The Modeling Optimization team within the Logistics organization is looking for a customer focused, analytically and technically skilled Senior Business Intelligence Engineer to join our team. This position will be responsible for building out analysis and visualization tools and processes’ to support our growing Logistics business.

You will be able to retrieve, integrate, visualize and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to improving the efficiency of the package delivery network. This work includes some software development in order to create scalable tools for rapid analyses. You will work with technical and business teams to optimize planning, execution, process improvement and track progress against goals. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as outstanding business acumen and comfort with technical teams and systems. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and enjoying working with large scale of data.


Responsibilities:
• Analyze and visualize large scale geo-spatial logistics and transaction data to determine user behavior or delivery process problems, and output solid analysis report with recommendation.
• Serve as the primary liaison between the research scientist team and the operations business teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current delivery performance, and ad hoc investigations into future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
• Develop queries and visualizations for ad-hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting.

title: Sr. Software Development Engineer
role_description:
Prime Now is Amazon's newest benefit for Prime members, which offers one-hour delivery on tens of thousands of daily essentials through a new mobile app. Prime Now is powered by Amazon’s growing network of fulfillment centers and transportation technology that utilize high-end technology to speed up order delivery times for customers. Now, Prime members can skip a trip to the store by shopping on the Prime Now app for products like paper towels, shampoo, books, toys and batteries with orders delivered right to their door in an hour or less. This is an early stage initiative with a fast paced, highly collaborative start up like environment inside Amazon. To be successful you need to be flexible and entrepreneurial.

The Prime Now Data Services team within Prime Now is a brand new team charted to process and apply data to improve Amazon’s last mile space. This team will consist of Data Engineers, Research Scientist and SDEs/MLEs under one umbrella to apply various techniques to build driven systems that will not only enable traditional analytics but also drive real time decision making. Do you want to be part of this interesting initiative where you can learn and apply various aspects of data and its applications and build systems that will scale for Amazon volume. As a SDE/ on this team, you will be responsible for build data driven system software systems that will enable real time decision making and will scale for Amazon’s volume. We have positions at various level of seniority, contact us for more information.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
role_description:
North America Supply Chain and Analytics team is looking for talented Business Intelligence Engineers (BIE) who will own analytics and develop solutions to optimize Inventory Planning, Inventory Placement and topology for NA Fulfillment network. As a member of this team, you will have an opportunity to be a thought leader in Amazon Supply Chain and work with some of the best research scientists, software developers, program managers and business leaders to design Amazon fulfillment network of future.

This position requires superior analytical thinkers, able to quickly approach large ambiguous problems and apply your technical and engineering expertise to rapidly prototype and deliver solutions. This skill also requires you to work across a variety of teams, including: transportation, operations, finance, category, delivery experience, and inventory platform (software) teams. Successful candidates must thrive in fast-paced environments which encourage collaborative and creative problem solving, be able to measure and estimate risks, constructively critique peer research, extract and manipulate data across various data marts, and align research focuses with the Amazon’s strategic needs.

Responsibilities
· Perform complex data analysis to identify different opportunities to reduce fulfillment costs or improve CX and set priorities to improve them.
· Draft proposals for new concepts, improvement plans, 3 year strategy and outlook.
· Design, develop and establish KPIs to monitor analysis and provide strategic insights to drive growth and performance.
· Work with large data sets, automate data extraction, and build monitoring/reporting dashboards and high­ value, self-service automated BI solutions.
· Build infrastructure and implement maintenance strategy for internal datasets to support swift analyses to answer critical business questions.

title: Economist
role_description:
Economists at Amazon are solving some of the most challenging applied economics questions in the tech sector. Amazon economists apply the frontier of economic thinking to market design, pricing, forecasting, program evaluation, online advertising and other areas. Our economists build econometric models using our world class data systems, and apply economic theory to solve business problems in a fast moving environment. A career at Amazon affords economists the opportunity to work with data of unparalleled quality, apply rigorous applied econometric approaches, and work with some of the most talented applied econometricians in the trade.

Amazon’s Consumer Analytics team is looking for Economists join our efforts to build the next generation of analytics systems at Amazon. You’ll work closely with machine learning scientists, finance partners, and senior leaders to make data-driven, principled decisions about marketing and program investments.
Economists should have proficiencies in one or more of the following areas:
· Data management
· Causal modeling (e.g., using regression, propensity matching)
· Experimental design
· Programming in one or more statistics-oriented languages (Stata, Python, R)
· Prediction and forecasting
· Structural model design and estimation
Economists work on a mixture of large-scale system design and theoretical economic and statistical problems in a fast-paced environment where creativity, speed, and careful work matter.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Senior SDE, Context Platform
role_description:
Amazon Search CX team is looking for a passionate and innovative Senior SDE to help lead the technical vision for our Context Platform team.

The Search team designs and builds the most-used product search and browse experiences on the planet. Our team is made up of world-class Software Engineers, Designers, Data Scientists and Usability Researchers, working around the globe in a close-knit and highly collaborative environment. We build server-side and native applications and experiences across desktop, phone, tablet and devices. Using machine learning and natural language processing we recognize customer intent to provide the most relevant information and features that help customers make the best purchase decisions possible. We build and manage the global high-performance computing infrastructure that creates the search results, swarming together data from hundreds of services across Amazon, in real-time. Everything we do is global, iterative and data-driven. We run hundreds of experiments each year. A few examples of our projects include: new discovery features that help customers find products and content faster and more easily, click prediction algorithms to reduce page latency, mining big-data to predict likely purchase scenarios from queries, voice-based search, and visual browsing experiences that inspire and inform customers about the latest trends and styles.

As the a Senior SDE on the Context Platform team, you will help define, build, and deliver a Tier 1 system that powers the aggregation of "Context." You're system will describe what we know about the query (e.g. does it contain a brand?) and about the customer (e.g. are they a Prime member? do they prefer digital content over physical?). Knowing the answer to these types of questions is critical in being able to help customers find what they're looking for.

You should be an experienced engineering with expertise in large scale distributed systems and should have a proven ability to design and deliver in a rapidly changing environment.

title: Programmer Analyst
role_description:
Since 1995, Amazon has focused on being "the world's most customer centric company." Our customers are worldwide, and include not just consumers, but also our sellers. World-class retail brands and individual sellers increase their sales and reach new customers by leveraging the power of the Amazon e-commerce platform. Over 2 million sellers offer new, used, and collectible selections to Amazon customers around the world. To meet our sellers' needs, our smart, diverse, customer-obsessed employees are constantly innovating and building on new ideas.

Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) is an Amazon service for our sellers. The FBA team partners with sellers and our Amazon fulfillment centers to create a seamless experience for sellers to leverage our world-class facilities. 71% of sellers who use FBA report more than a 20% increase in unit sales after joining FBA. In a very real way, we are changing lives with the work we do. Our FBA employees wake up every day thinking about how to enable our sellers to be successful on our platform. Enabling seller success allows us to provide Amazon customers with unparalleled selection and pricing. FBA is a win for sellers and a win for customers.

The FBA Analytics team is looking for a programmer analyst to help us evolve our technology by developing tools and processes that supplement and enhance our current data technology offerings. As a member of our dynamic team of Business Analysts, Data Engineers, Research Scientists, Business Intelligence Engineers, and Product Managers, you will leverage your passion for building to help drive the next generation of data analysis for the FBA business.

title: Principal, Program Manager - Benchmarking
role_description:
Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrived you wondered how it got to you so fast? Have you wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon to deliver it to you? If so, the Amazon Logistics, Last Mile team is for you. Our mission is to build the most efficient and optimal transportation solution on the planet, using our technology and engineering expertise. We aim to leverage cutting edge technologies in big data, machine learning, and optimization techniques, and operate high volume, low latency, and high availability services. We manage the delivery of tens of millions of products every week to Amazon’s customers, achieving on-time delivery in a cost-effective manner.

Come and see for yourself why we are one of the most admired company in the U.S., rated #1 in Innovation and #1 in Customer Service, and be part of our tradition of working hard, having fun and making history! At Amazon, we hire hands-on managers at all levels. These leaders in particular must be able to dive deep into the details on business, operations and engineering. We need technical, detail-oriented leaders who can build and grow organizations.

Amazon Logistics, Last Mile seeks a passionate, results-oriented, Principal Program Manager to lead the Last Mile competitor analysis and benchmarking program across traditional and crowd sourcing delivery service models. This role will maintain a working knowledge of business processes, services, and delivery methods currently available across the competitive landscape and will develop a benchmarking program to better inform business decisions.

Responsibilities include:
· Provide internal and external benchmarking with the objective of identifying best in class designs and processes
· Follow a data-driven methodology utilizing statistical analysis, data mining & modelling to validate drivers of process variation in order to identify best in class processes and operations
· Work with in-house scientists, global supply chain, transportation and logistics teams, and software teams to identify new features and projects
· Effectively build consensus and partner across multiple organizations

title: Senior Technical Program Manager
role_description:
Lighthouse is Amazon’s eye on inbound global inventory: we provide a real-time visibility on the end to end lifecycle of inventory from the time it is procured till the time it is received at the fulfillment centers. Lighthouse tracks all inflight inventory and expose this data to decision making systems e.g. Inventory placement, Inventory rebalancing, Customer Reactive Control, Affinity Transfers, Direct Import and many others. The inventory could take many different routes based on the program it follows. Direct Import Inventory will come through ocean then road, Transshipments will flow through cross docks for sorting and distribution before they arrive at fulfillment centers, Vendor-We Pay will go straight from vendors to FC through Amazon registered carriers. Lighthouse is in the heart of making customers happy by enabling decision making systems of making accurate promises. We create very large scale systems to keep track of all inflight inventory at any point across Amazon WW global supply chain. For Areas where we don’t have visibility, Prediction Systems will accurately predict the quantity, packaging and location of inventory. If you like working with research scientists, machine learning and big data, you will enjoy building a very sophisticated algorithms in the heart of Lighthouse.
As a Sr. Technical Program Manager in Lighthouse and Prediction Team, the individual will be responsible for capturing detailed program level requirements across different organizations, computing return of investments and value propositions with senior leadership, translate requirements into execution plans , engage closely with developers in design discussions and run software development lifecycle.

The successful candidate will be a person who enjoys and excels at diving into data to analyze root causes and implement long term solutions – changes in business policy or processes, updates to the models in our systems, creation of effective metrics and functionality, and identify the financial impact of those solutions. The goal is to improve the Amazon customer experience through improved selection, product availability, and fulfillment reliability while enhancing profitability.

title: Software Development Manager, AWS Machine Learning
role_description:
Interested in Machine Learning? Amazon Web Service's (AWS) Machine Learning (AML) team is Amazon's fully managed Machine Learning platform that makes it easy to build predictive models, manage them, and integrate them with custom applications for online predictions. We own and develop https://aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/. AML offers scalable regression and classification techniques on textual, categorical, and numerical data via easy-to-use APIs, an SDK, and AWS Console UI. It reduces the heavy-lifting normally associated with large-scale Machine Learning implementations, so that external developers and scientists can focus on the truly creative work of modeling and solving the business problem at hand.

As the Manager of Software Development, you will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in design, development, test, and deployment of distributed systems and big data / data mining solutions. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing distributed systems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:
· Responsible for the over-all systems development life cycle
· Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments; Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team within an Agile/Scrum environment
· Management of departmental resources, staffing, mentoring, and enhancing and maintaining a best-of-class engineering team
· Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach
· Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management
· Customer engagement and product road map definition.
If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, know how to deliver, are deeply technical, highly innovative and long for the opportunity to build pioneering solutions to challenging problems, we want to talk to you.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Engineer
role_description:
Imagine being part of a team that peers into the future to predict inventory flows for the millions of items available on Amazon.com worldwide. Inventory planning involves many algorithms to buy inventory in the right quantities, at the right frequencies, from the right vendors, and assigning to the best warehouse to fulfill forecasted customer demand. Our system lives at the heart of these algorithms, keeping up with the rapid pace of optimization improvements and simulating how they interact with each other. We simulate what these systems will do for months into the future, predicting inventory flows across the network, from vendors to customers. This experimentation platform is critical in understanding labor needs, managing our network capacity, and allowing continued optimizations to the many algorithms we simulate. Imagine enabling Amazon's supply chain systems to make data driven decisions based on simulations of trillions of inventory events per day.

The successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with data from multiple sources, and can partner with business leaders and internal stakeholders to answer key business questions. You should be able to effectively work and engage teams to build the models, analyze data sets and extract insights to answer those questions. Our team members have an opportunity to be on the forefront of supply chain thought leadership by working on some of the most difficult problems in the industry with some of the best software developers, product managers, machine learning research scientists, statisticians and economists in the business.

Responsibilities:
- Work closely with internal customers to identify and address issues and opportunities
- Analyze metrics to uncover trends and find root causes of prediction inaccuracies
- Build metrics, reports and dashboard to analyze key inputs to the simulation system and key outputs including accuracy/variance, and impact on downstream business metrics
- Provide feedback to guide the Research, Product Management and Software Development teams

- Strong problem solving and data analysis skills.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer, Promise
role_description:
Do you want to play a crucial role in the future of Amazon's retail business by applying advanced analytical techniques at the largest scale possible?

The Promise team sets the expectation for when customer's items will arrive. The delivery promises we make are key to acquiring and retaining customers and influence the short and long term profitability of Amazon’s global retail business. We serve as the interface between customer expectations and Amazon's industry leading fulfillment capabilities. We are part of the Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) Group that develops and manages systems that optimize inventory acquisition and placement so products are available for fast delivery. They also optimize transportation and fulfillment plans to enable delivery options for our customers.

The Promise team is seeking an Business Intelligence Engineer with strong analytical and broad technical skills to develop insights that enable new capabilities that enable optimization of delivery promises for Amazon's customers worldwide. The ideal candidate is a highly analytical, critical thinker with advanced problem solving, data mining, and software development skills. They will enjoy working with world-class economists, research scientists, data engineers, and software developers to drive decisions across Amazon’s retail and operations teams. Successful members of this team are customer obsessed, flexible, and collaborative team players who enjoying working across functions and organizations to solve problems and get results. They ask hard questions and build scalable solutions that provide critical business insight necessary to influence decision making across retail and operations teams. They find timely answers buried in large data sets and complex systems, identify root causes, get their hands dirty building data systems and sharing insight.

Responsibilities include:
· analysis of historical data to identify trends, develop predictive models and support decision making, including written and verbal presentation of results and recommendations
· collaborating with software development teams to design and implement analytic systems and data structures to support large-scale data analysis and delivery of machine learning and econometric models
· mining and manipulating data from database tables, simulation results and log files
· identifying data needs and driving data quality improvement projects
· understanding the broad range of Amazon’s data resources, which to use, how, and when
· provide thought leadership on data mining and analytic techniques

title: SR Mgr. Connections Research
role_description:
Amazon Connections is an innovative program that gives Amazonians a confidential and effective way to give feedback on the workplace and help shape the future of the company. By asking employees quick questions every day, Connections leverages real time information to learn more about their experiences and introduce positive changes with internal business partners around the world. Our goal is to help develop leaders who earn trust, remove barriers to excellence and make Amazon an inspiring place to work.

The Connections Research team is seeking highly analytic, technical, top-performing Leader to head a team of Research Scientists to support a new and innovative research practice at Amazon. This role will be responsible for conceiving, leading and driving innovative significant research projects with a global scope. It requires someone with extraordinary curiosity and an appetite to ‘go where the research leads them’. This Leader must demonstrate the ability to motivate and lead teams, challenge the team’s thinking and boundaries, have exceptional creativity and organizational skills, have excellent analytical skills, and exemplify Customer Obsession. This role provides opportunity for significant exposure to Amazon’s culture and global efforts to engage our employees.

Your Role

You conceptualize and lead global, complex research initiatives. The first, second, third, fourth, and fifth dead end will not stop you from motivating the team to discover that big game-changing insight. You develop innovative and even frighteningly bold plans and ideas to discover new ways to solve organizational problems. You are a subject matter expert, and know how to not only glide through analyses, but you can communicate complex findings to any audience. You are an influential leader, you know how to lead your customers to think bigger and gain maximum value from research. You are never held back by conventional ways of solving problems.

Job Responsibilities:
· Set vision, direction and motivation for a team of Research Scientists and support analysts
· Propose, scope, and initiate planning and design of research experiments ranging from medium to large scale projects. Conduct, direct, and coordinate all phases of research projects
· Lead, develop and execute validation and impact studies
· Strategically manage the goal development, design, research method, and analysis of data for multiple client groups ensuring broad, companywide, and global consistency
· Skilled at all stages of the analysis process including defining key business questions, recommending measures, data sources, methodology and study design, analysis execution, interpretation and presentation and publication of results.
· Define the vision, strategy and in some cases – the project requirements, and functional specifications, map current and future state business processes
· Lead your team to create and execute project plans, you will identify resource needs, and manage project schedule; collaborate effectively across teams to meet timelines and deliverables
· Own all communications to project members and stakeholders on progress, issues, and risks, provide pre and post launch communications to impacted teams
· Diagnose the most complex analysis problems

title: Sr. Mgr, SDM
role_description:
The Transaction Risk Management Systems division at Amazon is looking for a passionate, results-oriented, inventive software manager to take our Fraud Prevention Program to the next level. The TRMS division is responsible for the prevention of fraudulent and abusive transactions and malicious behavior on Amazon and delivers cost savings direct to Amazon's bottom line.

Payment Fraud Prevention Services
Payment Fraud Prevention Services strives to protect Amazon businesses exposed to customer abuse while maintaining the highest level of customer experience for our good customers. This means building highly sophisticated, data-centric systems that can detect abusive patterns across millions of transactions. We build highly scalable, flexible and distributed systems that utilize the power of data at every step - compute predictive variables, build models using machine learning algorithms and plug into different pipelines to prevent abusive transactions from taking place. As Amazon businesses grow, abusers morph to find new ways to take undue advantage, our engineers and scientists are constantly innovating to stay ahead of the game and protect Amazon and our customers. Our programs have bottom-line impact in the order of 10's of millions of dollars.

As the Senior manager, you will have technical ownership of mission critical systems that drive the program. You'll lead a talented and nimble team of managers and engineers and will define the vision for the program. You will build the team to deliver the vision.

Responsibilities include direct management of 2-4 managers who in turn manage a team of 15-20 engineers, process and quality of service improvements, strategic planning, project management for software within the team, and management of resources across teams. Successful candidates will be strong leaders who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery.

title: Sr Software Development Engineer, Community Trust
role_description:
Our team owns upholding trust in Amazon's Social/Community features like Reviews, Questions & Answers, Lists, and Profiles. The trust in these features, and their usefulness to shoppers, are major drivers of traffic to Amazon, and are incredibly important to preserve.

We're currently solving abuse detection problems not easily helped by human investigators, building text classification systems to ensure contributions meet guidelines, and ensuring that other teams in the company with similar needs benefit from our expertise. Making best use of the vast data Amazon collects on customer behavior, the rapidly growing number of contributions, and the evolving ways in which genuine and malicious customers behave, make our space interesting.

Our team includes engineers, product/program managers, research scientists and data engineers. We're looking for a software engineer to help drive the technical vision for the team, design and decide on new technologies, lead the implementation of projects, and mentor more junior engineers.

We're a diverse team of smart, dedicated individuals, who are passionate about operational excellence, high quality code, and our business space. Our org is different than the rest. We value transparency, empowerment, experimentation, and appreciation. We are free from the heavy operational burden that is associated with other teams, and are able to iterate in a low stress environment. Our solutions influence the products and plans of multiple internal teams, and our engineers design and build systems that improve the experience of millions of customers.

title: Senior Business Intel Engineer
role_description:
Amazon’s Topology Team is looking for a Senior Business Intel Engineer with strong analytical, communication and project management skills to join our team. Working closely with business stakeholders and senior leadership, you will help identify and solve complex Topology optimization problems, improve capacity planning systems and business processes, and develop metrics and reports to measure our impact on Amazon’s business. In a typical day, you will work closely with operations team, retail teams, machine-learning scientists, statisticians, software engineers, and various business groups.

You are an individual with outstanding analytical and modeling abilities, excellent communication skills, good business understanding, and technically savvy. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver who enjoys diving into data, is excited about investigations and algorithms, can multi-task, and can credibly interface between technical teams and business stakeholders.

Responsibilities
· Work closely with business customers, e.g,. Capacity Planners, Retail Instock Managers, to identify and address issues and opportunities.
· Analyze supply chain metrics to uncover trends and find root causes of issues.
· Build metrics for and analyze key inputs to the Topology systems.
· Build metrics to measure the output from the Topology systems.
· Gather user feedback, analyze data, run computational experiments, and fine-tune model parameters for new optimization and simulation models to support deployment.
· Provide business feedback to guide the Research Science, Product Management and Software Development teams.
· Develop and deliver user training on Topology concepts and systems.

title: Web Development Engineer, Personalization
role_description:
Amazon’s Personalization team owns recommending the right product to the right customer at the right time. The team revolutionized e-commerce with features like “Customers Who Bought Also Bought” and “Recommended for You”. Features we design, build and operate serve hundreds of millions of Amazon customers globally, across all product lines and devices (Kindle, Echo).
We are now working on new products built around Natural Language Understanding and Deep Learning. We are looking for applied scientists and engineers, hungry to invent and deliver the future of Artificial Intelligence.

We are a fun and collaborative group of expert engineers, researchers, and designers. Come and join us as we build new features end-to-end - from data collection, through large scale machine learning to amazing user experience.
You need a great sense for building data driven products, be excited to dive deep, experiment rapidly, and have a desire to learn new things.

We are an inclusive employer and value diversity at Amazon. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply now or ping Vaclav Petricek (https://www.linkedin.com/in/petricek) to learn more about the huge impact you will have.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
role_description:
Are you looking to solve exciting Fraud challenges in the cloud? Do you want to work on a Cloud business that is growing multiple fold annually? If so, we want to talk to you! We are seeking a talented Business Intelligence Engineer to help us evolve our processes and to improve customer experience across the globe.
The mission of the Fraud Prevention Team is to keep the AWS platform a safe and trusted place for our customers and partners. We achieve this goal by identifying and preventing fraud and abuse for all AWS services, worldwide. Every day fraudsters attempt to steal our services. We use extensive data and machine learning models to build software solutions to detect and prevent such activities.
As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will work directly with Data Scientists and Software Development Engineers to monitor the flavor/ trend of fraud worldwide and create appropriate actions to respond in a collaborative environment. There are no walls, and success is determined by your ability to dive deep, and understand the subtle demands new and complex services will place upon systems and teams.
What would I do?
· Lead day-to-day review of emerging fraud threats and work with the broader team to drive responses to combat them
· Deep dive on the problems using SQL and scripting language like R, Python and internal dashboards and drive short term and long term resolutions
· Handle escalations from AWS Management for Fraud and related activities
· Be the primary point of contact during fraud outbreaks – including analyses to identify responses and applying responses.
· Drive the design and development of tools to aid in operations and automation, such as creation of right dashboards to improve monitoring fraud
· Collaborate in a fast paced environment with multiple teams and customers in a dynamic entrepreneurial organization

title: Sr. Software Development Engineer, Outage Monitoring
role_description:
The Outage Monitoring team is responsible for detecting all customer-facing issues with Amazon's websites and drive holistic monitoring to understand and diagnose outage events to improve time to resolution of Amazon’s complex outages. We monitor millions of metrics in real-time to detect outages within seconds of impact. If you work on Site Reliability Engineering in your current role, we want to leverage your expertise to make Amazon the most reliable e-commerce experience in the world.

Amazon's Availability program is a unique opportunity to observe the inner workings of Amazon's website, become an expert in our platform and aggressively drive the elimination of defects in order to delight our customers. You will work with a group of technologists across the company to enhance the quality of our platform, supported by a talented team of software development engineers (SDEs) and technical program managers (TPMs).

Our team faces technical challenges such as: How do we detect a critical problem _before_ it manifests as a drop in customer orders? How do you architect the website such that it is able to withstand interruptions in the networking infrastructure? What would it take to achieve 100% uptime for Amazon.com?

You will work closely with Machine Learning Scientists and software developers to analyze past outages to come up with strategies to prevent future recurrence. You will help build solutions to capture, store, and visualize the big data sets that represent every Amazon customer request.

If you are interested in tackling problems of this nature, we would love to have you on our team. Successful candidates will have a technical background, be data driven and able to deal with ambiguity.

title: Sr Technical Program Manager
role_description:
The Supply Chain Optimization Technologies team is looking for an energetic, focused and skilled technical program manager for Inventory Placement, a multi-product group building the scalable software systems responsible for ideal placement of inventory across Amazon's global fulfillment centers, with significant influence over Amazon's multi-billion-dollar transportation spend in 10+ countries. The technologies we use span the gamut of linear programming, graph theory, Big Data analytics and machine learning in a high-scale, service-oriented, distributed environment.

The role will work across the entire organization including product managers, software development managers, software engineers, researchers and data scientists as well as our supply chain business partners to understand strategy, define requirements and architecture, make technology choices and establish timelines for continuous delivery of software supporting a number of existing and new Amazon initiatives. This position also involves regular communication with senior management on prioritization and execution of the global inventory placement roadmap.

The ideal candidate is an influencer with business and technology knowledge, a tremendous customer focus, a first class problem solver. This opportunity requires excellent program management, technical, problem-solving, and communication skills. At the core of the position is passion for delivering high quality, scalable systems that meet business needs in a staged, timely fashion. Ideal candidates participate in defining the path forward and resolving complex multi-team scheduling scenarios to drive the efficiency of a large development organization.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
role_description:
The IPC Adaptive Buying team builds and owns software that learns about and optimizes the automation of Amazon.com retail’s inventory purchasing strategies worldwide. Ever wonder how all of that “stuff” is available to sell on the website? How we decide to buy it, how much of it to buy, when to buy it, etc.? By taking manual human intervention out of the picture and instituting automation techniques and algorithms across terabytes of data and distributed services, the problem doesn’t get easier, but more challenging. We need top engineers to design, build, and guide others through that challenging future of buying automation and machine learning at Amazon.

As a senior software development engineer, you will be a technical owner and leader of IPC Adaptive Buying. You'll work on a talented and nimble team of engineers and scientists to create innovative ways that move, analyze, and feed large volumes of data into machine learning automation. Responsibilities also include leading, growing, and directly working with other engineers on software development, system design, and operational quality. Successful candidates will be strong engineers who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, have a consistent track record of delivery, and excellent software engineering skills. The Amazon business requires creative engineering balanced with high quality and customer focus. As a lead engineer you will bring those skills with you in designing and laying the groundwork for Amazon’s buying automation future.

Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon engineers:
· Exhibits excellent judgment
· Has relentlessly high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo)
· Is able to dive deep and is never out of touch with the details of the business or the technology
· Strong results orientation
· Thinks big
· Strong engineering background and software development skills

title: Economist
role_description:
The Economist will be a key member of the leadership team of Amazon Lending, a rapidly growing line of business at the intersection of finance and technology within Amazon. The position offers an opportunity to apply the frontier of econometrics to risk measurement, monitoring, and mitigation in the rich and evolving automated lending space. This thought leader will build econometric models, using world class data systems, and apply economic theory to solve business problems in a fast moving environment. The role is based in Seattle, WA.

Amazon is expanding into financial services and has launched with the small business lending segment. We believe we are in a unique position to serve our customers by leveraging very large datasets in new ways. The successful candidate will be a person who enjoys and excels at diving into data to analyze root causes and implement long term solutions – changes in business policy or processes, updates to the models in our systems, creation of effective metrics and functionality. This is a high visibility leadership role with tremendous scope for real-world impact.

As a deep domain expert, the Senior Economist will partner with technology and business leaders to build new services that surprise and delight our customers. Economics at Amazon is a highly experimental activity, although theoretical analysis and innovation are also welcome. The Senior Economist will work closely with economists, research scientists, and machine learning experts within Amazon Lending to design and run experiments, research new algorithms, and find new ways of measuring, monitoring, and mitigating credit risk.

The key strategic objectives for this role include:
a) Research underlying factors driving loan performance, including micro- and macro-economic drivers, behavioral factors, business cycle factors, and seasonality effects.
b) Build models to optimize Amazon Lending’s loan volume, credit risk, and operational efficiency.
c) Create a framework for assessing portfolio “tail” risks by measuring default correlations across diverse lending products and geographies.
listings:
[{"elements": ["PhD in Economics, Finance, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.

The ideal candidate will have 1+ years of relevant experience, including:
a) Experience formulating business problems and obtaining solutions in a quantitative/econometric framework.
b) Demonstrated ability to implement different techniques in predictive analytics, forecasting, or credit modeling & measurement.
c) Expertise in finance broadly, and analyzing loan performance data in particular.
d) Expected expertise includes at least one of the major statistical programs (STATA, SAS, GAUSS), one of the lower level languages having statistical packages (R, MatLab), as well as familiarity with standard databases such as SQL.
e) Strong verbal/written communication skills, including an ability to effectively collaborate with both research and technical teams.
f) Management and leadership experience or experience measuring default risk would be helpful but are not required.
"], "type": "Basic Qualifications"}, {"elements": ["a) 2-3 years of experience in both business and academic environments.
b) Strong record of academic publication in economics and/or business journals.
c) Experience communicating with senior executives."], "type": "Preferred Qualifications"}]

title: (Pooling Req) Web Development Engineer – AWS CloudWatch
role_description:
Web Development Engineer


"The commonality between science and art is in trying to see profoundly - to develop strategies of seeing and showing."
"I think it is important for software to avoiding imposing a cognitive style on workers and their work."
- Edward Tufte

AWS CloudWatch provides a gateway for AWS customers to see and understand at a glance the state of their entire infrastructure and application state. Our goal is to help our customers measure, diagnose, understand and improve their applications as quickly as possible. Our customers are operating compute at enormous scale and we continuously collect a mind bogglingly large amount of data about the state of that compute. We need to find really amazing ways to represent all that data in a glance, drawing the customers eyes to precisely the right visual display such that they understand immediately what's going on.

We're looking for web development engineers with a passion for visual display of quantitative data and modern web technologies to help us achieve that. If you would like to help shape how the world of compute thinks about managing infrastructure, applications, and their businesses using real time streaming data visualization, breaking down that barrier of human and computer interaction, we have a wonderful opportunity for you. If you love the elegance of a beautiful data dense presentation as much as you love the elegance of asynchronous JavaScript and the beauty of well factored CSS, then you've found your home.

In joining us you'll join a small team of highly motivated and veteran web services engineers, web developers, and user experience professionals and have a foundational role in building out a next generation experience for our customers. We believe strongly in building a strong team culture of cooperation focused on continuously improving the speed with which we can develop and the quality of our software.

Major Responsibilities:

· Implement next generation visualization platforms for AWS CloudWatch using modern web technologies
· Participate in high quality test driven software engineering to ensure a high quality customer experience
· Iterate rapidly to deliver continuous value to customers
· Work closely with user experience professional, service engineers, product managers, and data scientists
· Direct interaction with customers to understand their needs
· Interview and mentor other web developers and software development engineers
· Understand, implement, and help refine user experience designs and style guides

Preferred Qualifications
